Please accept this for your continued service to Jonferco.
Jonferco would like to offer this gift for your continued service.
OTAS(speak Oh-Tass) are looking for someone to work for us.
OTAS has regular work for someone like you.
Your loyalty to OTAS is recognised with this gift.
OTAS offers you this reward for your continued service.
Plutarch is looking for someone to do some work for us.
Plutarch has regular work for a pilot like you.
Plutarch recognises your loyal service with this reward.
Plutarch offers you this as a reward for your continued service.
Hello Cadet, congratulations on successfully completing your training. I request your presence for a discussion; find me at the trading station.

Ah, there you are, cadet. Now that your training is concluded, it's time for the actual duties. Your initial assignment involves joining a patrol squad, but before that, I must ensure you are adequately prepared.
I require a demonstration of your combat skills. I will deploy a set of drones; your task is to eliminate them.
Outstanding effort, cadet. You are now prepared to join your patrol group. In case your ship sustained damage, ensure its repair by ejecting into your space suit and utilizing the repair laser.
Your subsequent task involves linking up with your patrol leader, who awaits you in Home of Light Gamma. Best of luck, cadet.
Here it comes, watch yourself
Great job, please return for further discussion.

Hello, pilot. I understand you're curious about our presence in Argon Space. I'm an ATF agent, currently conducting an investigation into peculiar AGI sightings. These instances bear a resemblance to the old #deca ships, but there's something distinctly unusual about them.
Certainly, pilot. We pursued several of these vessels into Argon space, where we encountered them in combat.

The details are unclear at the moment, but there seems to be a potential connection to another faction. While on our journey, we identified a ship affiliated with the Beryll, leading us to suspect their involvement in some way.
Regrettably, our current capacity for assistance is limited. I recommend initiating an investigation into these reported Beryll sightings.
It's good to have you here, hunter. We've got incoming pirates; lend us your hand in dealing with them.
That's all of them. Thank you for your assistance; we can handle the rest from here.
Greetings pilot, how can the Argon Military help you?
Are you certain you want to resign your commission? If you decide to rejoin, you'll need to start over as an Enlistee.

Welcome, pilot. Today, your flight school training will cover the fundamental aspects of piloting a spacecraft. To begin, you should establish communication with your instructor, who is currently navigating a ship within this sector. Identify them through the distinctive icon positioned above their spacecraft.

This identifying icon is also visible on the sector map, facilitating your search for the instructor. The various icons you observe signify available missions. In the case of the flight instructor, their icon resembles a book, indicating a plot or, in this instance, the tutorial mission.

Feel free to locate your instructor and initiate communication with them for further instructions. Happy flying.
Ok pilot, now you have the basics, contact me for some additional training.

Greetings, pilot. While your contributions to our war efforts have been significant, we now require you to demonstrate your unwavering loyalty to the Terran cause. We have several critical missions for you, all involving strikes against the Argon.
Excellent work, pilot. Report back to me for your next assignment.
Your next mission involves eliminating high-priority Argon targets. You'll be operating within Argon Core sectors, which will be extremely hostile territory for you.
With those targets eliminated, continue supporting our efforts against the Argon.
That's it, pilot. Welcome to the Terran war effort.

page.title: Polly: UK: Arthur
page.t: Hey! You're either blind or stupid; maybe both.
I won't say this again, stand down.
This is your last chance - break it off.
You just crossed the line, make your peace.
Vessel under attack, require immediate assistance.
I hope you choke on my waste pipe!
Look, I'll give you anything! Anything!
Losing hull integrity. Son of a...!
I'll see you on the other side! Arrrgh!
Got it!
Pilot, you clearly have no idea how close you are to death. Stand down.
Your ignorance astounds me. Cease fire.
Weapons systems are now locked. Any last requests?
Spit it out, pilot.
Get bent, weedhead!
Not a good time right now.
You're not going to get any data from me.
Nothing to do with me.
The hell I will!
Do you have any idea what you're saying!?
That's great! Just what I needed!
No more! I'm bailing out! She's yours!

(Goner priest)These aren't the droids, errr, (cough)wares you're looking for... you can continue.
The chances of anything coming from Mars are a... oh, 1 to 1.
Allow me to perform the Goner Mine Meld... My mine to your mine, my supports to your supports...
Red 5, I'm going in!
Appreciate the help; you've just rescued me. The trade routes appear to be growing increasingly perilous with each passing day.
Gratitude to the military; we've reached Argon space. I should be alright from here. Appreciate your invaluable assistance.
Pleasure to meet you pilot. Word has it you've been a great help in Yaki space. Is there anything you require?

We’ll gladly set up a meeting. The Beryll can be found in the Mists of Artemis sector, located within Yaki space but concealed behind a wormhole. Once you arrive, your Beryll contact will be waiting for you.

page.title: Polly: Irish, Niamh
page.t: Hey! Have you gone crazy? Stop shooting!
Hey! If you are looking for a fight you will get one.
Are you looking for trouble? One more shot and I will call in a support ship!
Ready or not here I come!
My shields are going down... Please someone help me!
See how you like this!
I'm not too happy about this. Please stop!
You've wrecked my shields!
AAAAARGH!
(affirmative)Yeah!
What a unique way to commit suicide!
Either you know something that I don't, or you're very very stupid.
I don't like killing crazy people, but for you I'm making an exception!
What assistance do you require?
Go and fly into a black hole!
Can't you see that I am busy?
Do me a favour - just go away!
Sorry, I'm not responsible for that.
Just what are you talking about? I haven't even started to fight yet!
What? You must be kidding?
Surrender to the likes of you? Don't make me laugh!
Standby, I am abandoning ship, take it!
You! Hang on I'm releasing it!
Captain speaking. Are you trying to make contact?
Do you really think our purpose is to help your type of pilot?
I am busy. Please do not interrupt me again.
You want what? You are in grave danger of annoying us. Go away for your own safety.
Captain speaking. We rarely meet such a cosmic comedian as yourself. The only reason you're still alive is that we are too busy laughing to shoot you!
I'm not sure, but you could try looking beyond the
Pilot, I'm no expert, but you are already here!
Sorry, I don't know that location myself!
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
The Argon are pleased to assist you. Try flying through the
I am happy we could help you! Farewell, pilot.
That'll be
credits for every gate we go through.
I'm sorry. We've got our hands full transporting stuff for someone else. We'll be free after we've finished!
Give me a call back when you can afford us!
We have a deal. We'll follow and charge for every gate we pass through!
There's no room here to drop you freight. Can I suggest you try deploying somewhere else.
Everything's just fine - we'll start unloading here.
It's been a financial pleasure meeting you. Come back soon.
We detected illegal goods aboard your ship. Drop your illegal Goods immediately or we will open fire!
This is the last warning! Drop your illegal goods immediately!
We scanned your ship and did not find any illegal goods aboard. Thanks for your cooperation.
Pilot, forgotten something? I have to get to my destination quickly!
I demand that you let me out at the next station you dock at!
Give up your freight or it's goodnight stranger!
It's all mine!
I know you have more!
Pirate assistance needed out here!
Unlucky - you're gonna face it alone!
Pirates must stick together - help is on the way!
(Goner sentences, gentle voice)Peace to you my child, have you heard the good news?
We come in peace. Please don't fire upon me.
Please, I only mean to spread the good news.
We came in peace, but you dealt in death!
Despite our peaceful intent you still fire on us. Now we have no option but to call for fighter support.
I don't want to talk to you!
What? No!
Never! I would rather die!
OK. I give in.
Greetings hunter. We're considering relocating the guild headquarters and seek your assistance in this endeavor.
We've established contact with an individual who possesses information about a potential new sector location. Kindly approach and engage in a conversation with them.

To establish a connection to the new system, we must construct a Trans-Orbital Accelerator. Unfortunately, our current resource stockpile is dwindling, and we require your assistance in delivering additional resources for the construction process.
Our construction vessel is prepared. Kindly rendezvous with us in Getsu Fune.
Hello, hunter. Welcome. Your assistance would be greatly appreciated.

We're in the process of establishing a new shipyard for crafting cutting-edge vessels. Once operational, you'll have access to these ships as a valued hunter. However, to commence construction, we need a variety of resources. Your assistance in gathering these materials would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your efforts, pilot. We require another batch of goods to proceed with the shipyard construction. Your continued assistance in providing these resources is invaluable as we press on with the project.

Thank you, pilot, for the delivery. Those wares will prove quite valuable. However, we still require another set of resources. Your assistance in acquiring these additional wares would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you hunter, for your help in acquiring the necessary wares. We have what we need for the time being. However, there is another pressing matter that demands your attention. Please come and speak with me.

Ah, hunter, we have an urgent task that requires your immediate attention. Our freighters, currently en route to deliver equipment for our shipyard, have come under pirate attack. We need your assistance in protecting them. Eliminate all the pirates so that the freighters can safely resume their deliveries.
Hunter, we have another freighter that requires protection. Please proceed there immediately and offer your assistance
Thank you for your help. However, we have one last assignment for you. Please return to headquarters so we can discuss it further.

Hunter, we're in need of additional Teladianium paneling to complete the construction. There's a stock available at a nearby factory, but they lack the necessary ships for delivery. We require you to retrieve them.
Your contribution is greatly appreciated, hunter. With the resources you've provided, we can now complete the construction of your shipyard. As a result, you now have access to purchase our ships.

page.title: Polly: US, Stephen
page.t: (00..10: Speaker can be ANYONE, see below for variations. Texts marked with '*' can be used by capital ships, do not use 'I' or 'my' etc. ==== Message after first -possibly accidental- hits)Hey you! Are you nuts? Stop shooting!
(Final warning of fighter, also for pirates)You're really gonna regret that!
(Final warning of transporter)Are you looking for trouble? One more shot and I'll call in a support ship!
(Starts fighting/defending)Hey, you'll really look cool as a bit of space debris!
(* Requesting help from anyone)This ship is under attack! Somebody please help!
(* Swear words - superior)You're gonna get it now!
(* Swear words - inferior)Please! Stop shooting!
(* Shields low - Pilot close to giving up!)Hey! I can't take any more of this! Give me a chance!
(* Final cry)AAAAARGH!
(* Affirmative)Yeah! Will do.

(11..19: Variations for capital ships, slightly arrogant! ==== Warning message after some -possibly accidental- hits)I demand you stop firing or you will be in more trouble than you could possibly imagine!
(Final warning)You have received your last official warning. Any more trouble from you and you'll be vaporised.
(Starts fighting)Don't say we didn't warn you. Now prepare to die!
What is it pilot?
(During fight, or if player is public enemy. Can be said by person in a station too!)Go play with asteroids!
(Busy)Leave me alone - I'm too busy to babysit another spacemonkey!
(Does not want to answer, possibly too low notoriety)Hey, I'm not an information station, find someone else who can help you!
(Always the same sentence - Pilot is not responsible for answering a question)Sorry, I'm not responsible for that.
(25..29: Answers on Surrender or Drop freight ==== Fighter or pirate makes fun of player, possible even during fight!)Surrender to the likes of you? Don't make me laugh!
(TS pilot or other people)You must be kidding?
(After being attacked)Never! I would rather die!
(Ship giving up STEP 2 - Pilot now leaves the ship)OK. I give in. Here is my ship, take it, but don't kill me!
(Ship giving up STEP 1 - Dropping some freight)Please spare my life. Here is a part of my freight!
(30..34: Variations of 20..24 for capital ships, slightly arrogant! ==== Captain speaking)Captain speaking. What do you want?
(During fight, or if player is public enemy)We do not communicate with pilots such as you!
(Busy)Can't you see we're a bit busy just now?
(Does not want to answer, possibly too low notoriety)Who do you think you are? We are not an information office!
(35..39: Capital ship answer on Surrender! ==== Captain is amused/annoyed)Hahaha! That's a funny one. I'll have to tell that to the admiral next time I see him!

(40.: Player asking for a way to an object, pilot KNOWS the answer. This can be either a station a factory or a sector so do NOT use an article in these sentences. Keep all sentences as general as possible. Gate direction is added behind this answer)That is easy. Try behind the
(Player asking for a way, player is already there. Sentence can answer questions for all kinds of objects so avoid articles)You are already there.
(Player asked for a way to an object. Pilot cannot answer)Sorry, I've no idea.
(45..49: Directions added to sentences above)North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
(50..54: Different capital ship answer, slightly arrogant! ==== Player is hero)No problem. You have to fly through the
(After telling player the sector)I'm glad we could help you! Good bye.
(60..69: Speaker is Transportation officer aboard a TL ==== Formatted string, do not change) {,61} {1} {,62} (assembles price sentence, param 1 = xxxx Credits)
(Telling price, part 1)That'll be
(Telling price, part 2)credits for every gate we go through.
(Cannot be hired)I'm sorry. We've got our hands full transporting cargo for someone else. We'll be free once our contract is over!
(Player cannot pay or ran out of money)Give me a call back when you can afford us!
(TL hired)We got a deal. We'll follow and charge for every gate we pass through!
(Not enough space for station)There's no room here to drop your freight. I suggest you try moving somewhere else.
(Job finished)Everything's just fine - we'll start unloading here. (followed by Good bye)
(Good bye when job finished/cancelled)It's been a financial pleasure meeting you. Come back soon.
(70 - 74: 4 different TL fee classes per race, depending on notoriety. Rule for 70 is: A=1000, B=1400, S=1800, P=1200, T=500, Hero)1000
(70 - 74: 4 different TL fee classes per race, depending on notoriety. Rule for 71 is: A=3000, B=3500, S=4000, P=3400, T=1500, Trusted Friend)3000
(70 - 74: 4 different TL fee classes per race, depending on notoriety. Rule for 72 is: A=5000, B=5500, S=6000, P=5600, T=2500, Accepted Friend)5000
(70 - 74: 4 different TL fee classes per race, depending on notoriety. Rule for 73 is: A=10000, B=10800, S=12000, P=11000, T=5000, Suspected Foe)10000
(75..79: Speaker is police ship ==== Illegal goods found)We have detected illegal goods aboard your ship. Drop these items immediately or we will open fire!
(Warning if player does not react) This is your last warning! Drop the illegal goods immediately!
(No illegal goods found) We scanned your ship and did not find any illegal goods onboard. Thanks for your cooperation.
(80..81: Speaker is passenger aboard player's ship ==== Reminder)Hey, did you forget me, pilot? I have to get to my destination quickly!
(Wants to leave)I demand that you let me off at the next station!
(82..89: Speaker is a pirate ==== Player has good freight)Drop your freight or I will blast you to pieces!
(Player dropped container)Haha, that's what I like! Easy credits..!
(Pirate wants more)Don't play games with me! I want more or I will show you the real meaning of firepower!
(Less loud to third ship)Hey friend. Please help me against this maniac here!
(Less loud, neg.answer)Don't give me that friend crap. Fight for yourself man!
(Less loud, pos.answer)OK. I will come by to support you friend!
(90..99: FOR ARGON PAGES ONLY: Speaker is Goner, with very gentle voice ==== Preaching)Peace to you my son, have you heard the good news?
(Message after -possibly accidental- hits)Please do not fire. We come in peace.
(After several shots)Please spare my life!
(Is enemy, further attacks)We came in peace, but you deal in death!
(Requesting help)Despite our peaceful intent you still fire on us. Now we have no option but to call for fighter support.
(During fight, or if player is public enemy)I don't want to talk to you!
(Answer on Surrender)What? No!
(Surrender after being attacked)Never! I would rather die!
(Goner surrenders)Ok. I give in.
Certainly assassin. We request an administration fee of 20,000 credits.
Excellent, before we accept your membership, we have an assignment for you.

page.title: Polly: US, Matthew
page.t: Hey! That had better have been an accident!
I suggest you leave me alone or you'll be sleeping with the spaceflies!
Keep that up and you'll regret it!
Don't say I didn't tell you so! You'd better run and hide!
Someone! Please help! I'm under attack!
You got the flying skills of a large asteroid!
For pity's sake!
Argh, I can't take much more of this!
I'll see you on the other side! Arrrgh!
Yep!
Guess the odds of you winning this... Yep, you lose!
We won't warn you again. Next time you die!
Don't say you weren't warned!
Are you looking for something?
Don't you have a sun to fly into?
You picked a bad time, sorry.
You're confusing me with someone who cares.
Sorry, not my problem.
Surrender?! I don't think so.
Is this your stupid idea of a joke?
It's a good day to die!
OK, I give up, I'm punching out... Take the ship!
Here, take this freight and leave me in peace.
Bridge Commander speaking. State your business.
Oh, you want to talk now, do you? Unlucky!
No time to stop and chat; find someone else to annoy.
You must have a comm problem, talk to someone else.
Suh-ren-der?.. That's my line, so get out of here before you die.
Try checking close to the
I suggest checking your navigation computer, You're already there!
I have no clue
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
You just need to fly through the
Glad to be of assistance.
You appear to be carrying contraband. Jettison them or face the consequences.
We won't tell you again. Drop the illegal goods.
No contraband is indicated on our scans. Thanks for your patience.
Notice any extra oxygen consumption on board recently?(sarcastic)
I won't put up with this any longer. Let me off!
That freight has my name on it. Drop it or regret it.
You're more clever than you look.
Now you've tested the release mechanism, drop the rest!
Heeelp! Someone help me deal with this idiot.
You're doing a great job there... I'll just watch.
OK. Help is on the way.
(laughter)
(laughter)
(curses)Damn oxygen thief!
(curses)Drink plasma!
(greeting)Hey there.
(bye)So long!
(excuse)I beg your pardon.
(pain)Aaaggghh!
(thanks)Much obliged.
Over to the
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Rolling in to engage the enemy!
I'm being roasted here!
(Under attack)...being fried!
Shields are going down!
My hull is being pummelled!
I can't lose them!
The main reactor is just about to go!
There's too many bogeys!
Yeah! Notch one for me!
Got it!
Take this!
How about a space dust diet?
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
(fleeing)I'm making a run for it!
(fleeing)Time to get out of here!
I've got an inbound missile!
It's locked on me; the missile has a lock!
(prefix to 803 )Good timing!
(prefix to 803 )Ah! Just in time.
(prefix to 803 )Glad you called.
(generic job)I've got something that might interest you then.
(combat mission)I'm looking for a fighter pilot.
(I need a ship)I need a ship.
(I need some wares)I'm looking for someone to pick up some stuff for me.
(protection mission)I need some protection.
I'm looking for a freighter pilot.
(assassination)I need someone taken care of.
(transport)I've got a passenger needing transport.
(transport)I need a ride.
(urgent transport)I need to get out of here, fast.
I need someone to build me a station.
(NPC wants some wares or ships)We need you to deliver some items.
I need to find someone.
I'm looking for someone to work for me.
Yeah, I've got another job for you.
I need help.
Does that interest you?
Do you want to see the details?
Do you want the job?
Transmitting information now.
Sending details now.
This is what we need...
This mission should be easy.
This might be a bit tricky.
This might prove a hard mission.
This mission should not take too long.
This job might take a while.
You should expect enemies on the way.
Watch out for police during the mission.
Watch out for enemies during the mission.
Thanks, couldn't have done it without you.
(Mission Complete)You did a great job!
(Mission Complete)Thanks for your assistance.
(Mission Complete, recurring)Thanks, great work as usual.
(Mission Complete, could be better)Ok, that will do. Could have been better though.
(paying player)Transferring your money now.
(Mission Failed)That was terrible! Get out of here!
(Mission Failed Mid Mission)This mission is over!
(player running away)Where are you going?
(Guidance Hint)Check your guidance.
(Time Update)You're running out of time.
(Time Update)That's it. You're out of time.
(offensive action against mission object or actor)What are you doing??
Sorry, I wanted an experienced pilot.
You need a combat ship for this.
You need a transport ship for this.
You're going to need a jumpdrive.
You'll need a transporter device.
Go get yourself one!
(Passenger on board)Okay, I'm onboard.
(Passenger on board)Now get me to my destination!
Get a move on!
Let me disembark.
(Passenger getting off)Thanks for the ride!
I can't fit onboard that!
(No life support)You need a cargo life support system to transport passengers!
(passenger wont slum it in a fighter)I'm not getting on that, get a Passenger Transport.
(delivery brought)Delivery received.
(More deliveries required)Awaiting further deliveries.
(Ship has no equipment)Get some equipment installed.
Transferring wares now!
(something is wrong)What do you call this?
Intercept and destroy all hostile ships!
Fall back and regroup at Command!
(reinforcements arriving)Thought we'd drop by to clear up your mess.
Reinforcements arriving through the (gate)
(reinforcements have arrived)Glad to see you.
Enemy ships inbound through the (gate)
Good work, pilot. Proceed to base for repairs.
Hold this position.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Follow my lead!
We've got incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Move to intercept!
Watch out for those mines!
(Transport to player)Watch our back.
(cargo bay full)You need to clear some cargo space.
(want player to dock to get wares)Dock here so I can transfer the wares.
(want player to dock to get info)Not safe to transmit this openly, dock here and I'll send the data.
(player got ship for npc)Dock it here then.
What are you waiting for? Get on with it!
(generic dock request)You need to dock.
(distance guidance)You need to get close.
(distance guidance, panicked. Could be a hostile or concerned guide)Get away from it!
(no missions available)Nah, not got anything for you.
(reward for continued service)Your continued service to us cannot go unrewarded. We insist you accept this token of our appreciation.
Our scans reveal you are carrying an illegal passenger. Release this person immediately.
Okay, come back later if you change your mind.
Please stop that!
That's okay. Try again.
Good! You've got it.
Very good!
That's the way!
Are you following me?
Here are the prices.
Ok, time to move.
Resuming the Patrol.
No more bogeys, Lets roll out.
Onward to the next sector
You're getting too close, drop back.
Nice to see you again, Ulla. This must be your new protégé.
The plan is to send you undercover with the Beryll to gather as much information as you can.
We have no choice, Ulla. We need to find out what's going on, and this is our only option.
Before you go undercover, pilot, we have another assignment. We need Zeta to patrol for more Beryll sightings. We have a new scanning device that we'll install to gather more information.
We've received several reports of activity near the Shore of Infinity. Your mission is to patrol the area and utilize the scanning device. Avoid engagement and return here upon completion.
The scanner is installed to your ship and ready to go. If you plan to use another ship, remember to transfer the scanner over.
Welcome back, pilot. The data from the scanner will be invaluable. Now, we need you to infiltrate the Beryll.
First, you will need to build your reputation with the Yaki and gain access to their capital, Tortuga's Retreat. From there, you can investigate the Beryll further.

Yes, this is crucial. You will be operating undercover, and no one will know you're working for us. As a result, any Argon Military personnel will see you as an enemy. Do whatever it takes to maintain your cover.
Ah, there you are, cadet. We have something that we believe will help you gain favour with the Beryll.
It's called the Spacelab Headquarters, a unique new station you can use as your base of operations. The headquarters also enables you to hire diplomats who can help improve your reputation.
We're loading it onto a TL ship at the Argon Prime Shipyard. Head there and instruct the captain where you want it deployed.
Nice to see you again pilot, this must be your Beryll contact?
That’s promising. What else can you share about this splinter faction?
Understood. We’ll analyze all the information and see what we find. What are you hoping to achieve from this?
Certainly, we can agree to that in exchange for your continued assistance.
Alright, pilot, we will review this information and reach out to you once we have a plan in place.
Good to see you again, Sergeant. We need to look into this splinter faction and determine what they're up to and where they're located.
It's great to have you here, Yvona. I've also brought in Zeta Flight to assist us.
We've discovered that a Beryll cell split off to establish its own faction and has been targeting traders for a while. What more can you tell us, Yvona?
So, they might be attempting to assist the Xenon or even expand their numbers.
How are they able to keep a sector hidden?
If it's unstable, how could they use it to access their sector?
I believe the best course of action is to locate and scan their ships to see if we can reverse engineer their devices

That sounds promising; we will continue our research. In the meantime, I'd like you to deploy new spy satellites capable of detecting the presence of their ships. We also have a new scanner you can use to gather information from their vessels. It was initially designed for use against the Terrans, but it should be effective here as well.
We've been monitoring the situation and believe we may be able to use a Low Frequency Locator to detect a potential hyperspace relay.
Alright, that’s sorted. We’ll begin constructing a Trans-Orbital Accelerator so everyone can pass through.
Looks like there’s nothing here. We’ll head back and analyze the data. We’ll contact you later, Sergeant.
Welcome, pilot. We seek combat veterans to join our ranks. An administration fee of 40,000 credits is required. Upon payment, we'll assign you a task to evaluate your skills. Are you interested?
Excellent, pilot. You are close to joining our esteemed ranks. First, we need to test your abilities. I've assigned you a new patrol route to demonstrate your skills.
Congratulations, Private. You've officially joined the ranks of the Terran Military. Welcome to Patrol Lambda. Seek further assignments at the various outposts across Terran space.
Greetings pilot, What can the Terran Military do for you?
Are you certain you want to resign your commission? If you decide to rejoin, you'll need to start over as an Enlistee.

Greetings, Corporal. Our next assignment is urgent. We've received reports of multiple attacks on our ships in Commonwealth space. Your mission is to protect our vessels and ensure the safe recovery of our pilots.
We're jumping to Elysium of Light, meet us there Corporal. Make sure you have a cargo life support system in case we need to pickup any pilots.
Glad you could join us, Corporal. We're planning to scout this sector and search for our missing pilots. Stay alert and keep your eyes open.
Then lets check it out. Lambda flight: head to the west and investigate.
Looks like they ejected just in time. Corporal, go rescue our stranded pilot.
Alright, Corporal, let's get them back to the outpost in Saturn.
Thank you for your help, Corporal. We’ll be in touch with your next assignment soon.

Corporal, we have your next assignment. After debriefing the pilot you rescued, we've detected a rise in terraformer activity. These units are not like the Xenon, but more akin to the original terraformers. We need to locate their origin.
Alright, Corporal, we have several sectors to scout. We'll begin in Elysium of Light. Rendezvous with us there.
Neither do I
Right, lets try the next sector
Keep scanning
It looks like some kind of wreck, we should scan it.
No signs of terraformers detected, but this data will be valuable. We should proceed with an analysis.
Lets head back to Saturn.
Analysing this data might take some time. We’ll reach out to you once your next assignment is ready.
Alright, Corporal, let's begin the scouting mission. Keep your scanners ready.
Lets continue with the scouting

Welcome back, Sergeant. We've encountered a roadblock in our investigation and could use your help. We've identified several key individuals from the Commonwealth races who might be able to assist. Your task is to gather them for us. I will send you the contact details.
Outstanding, Sergeant. Their knowledge will significantly aid our research objectives.
Stand down for now. We require time to finalize the next phase. You’ll receive new orders when the operation resumes.

Pilot, your recent efforts have uncovered something extraordinary — wreckage of Xenon ships and a damaged gate, hidden deep in the lost colony sectors. This could be the key to understanding what happened to the Pioneers.
Your mission is clear: find and scan these wrecks, extract whatever data you can, and prepare for what lies ahead. The future of the Pioneers depends on it.

Sergeant, we’ve completed the analysis of the debris you recovered. What we’ve found... is unexpected. The materials are from an old Terraformer ship design — not Terran, but definitely of early human origin.

Its construction and technology date back to a much earlier era, long lost to our history. High Command has classified the incident and issued orders for a thorough investigation. You have been assigned to this operation.
There’s a theory gaining traction — one that’s hard to believe. Some in Command think we may have uncovered evidence of the Lost Colonies.

Long ago, during the first waves of human colonization, several pioneer missions were sent out. These explorers vanished without a trace. Most assumed they were lost to accidents or the Xenon. But what you found suggests something else.

I know this is unexpected, but you’ve proven capable. Earth needs you on this mission. Your new orders are to join lambda patrol to investigate this further. This operation is classified. Discuss it with no one outside this circle.
They knew something was coming. Whatever forced this ship off the grid... it left them no options. High Command will want to see this.
We’ve gone over the logs. The ship was part of an unsanctioned expedition. No record in High Command’s files. But the technology… it's Terran, just old. Too old.
That initiative was classified. We believed they were all lost after the gate collapse. If even a fragment of their colonies survived…
You'll be working with Specialist Roe. She’s well versed in these black-site archives and has invaluable insights.
You’ll need to travel to several sectors and persuade the scientists to help. Expect complications. These aren’t your average researchers.
Find them. Convince them. The future of Terran history might depend on what they uncover.
We've been going through the recovered telemetry from the wreck you scanned in the last mission. It’s... old.
I mean really old. Early Terraformer-era tech. Possibly even older.
Which brings us to your next assignment.
There are possible gate remnants in the outer sectors. Our scans indicate old Terraformer debris and warped subspace trails nearby.
Head out. Locate the wreckage. Scan for targeting residue. If we can find coordinates, we may be able to establish a jump path to whatever’s left behind the gate.
Let’s bring the Pioneers home.

First stop on our search. This sector was once mapped by early Terran scouts, but little survived from that era. The Pioneers passed through here—follow your waypoint and let’s see what history left behind.

Segaris… it’s seen a lot of change since the Gate Shutdown. Some say the Pioneers tried to establish a supply route through here. Check the marked location, if they left wreckage, it may tell us more.

This region's under the shadow of Darkspace now. They're not officially hostile, but don’t expect a warm welcome. If the Pioneers hid something out here, odds are Darkspace already knows about it—and might not want us finding it.
These coordinates were flagged during long-range scans. The wreck we're looking for is old—likely predating the current Xenon evolution cycle.
According to the logs, the Pioneers fought to the last. They weren’t just cut off—they were sacrificing everything to protect what they’d built.
Keep your eyes open. There may be more than wreckage out here… the Xenon rarely leave anything untouched.

That’s a negative. No wreckage, no signal drift… nothing that points to Pioneer activity. Just empty space and old ghost echoes. Mark the search as inconclusive. Let’s move to the next sector, we might have better luck there.

No usable wreckage here either. The signs of a battle are faint at best, if they exist at all. This sector might’ve seen skirmishes, but if the Pioneers left anything behind, it’s well hidden. Let’s push forward to the next location.

Contact! The wreck’s right where the scans predicted. Hull signature matches Pioneer-class frigate. We’ll need to scan thoroughly and extract what data we can. This could be the key to unlocking the Pioneers’ fate.
Scan complete. We've gathered all available data from the wreck. Head back to Saturn Outpost for analysis and next orders.
Good work out there. The data we recovered confirms what we suspected, the Pioneers fought a desperate battle before sealing off their gate.
This wreck tells a story of sacrifice and survival, hidden away in the shadow of Darkspace's influence.
Prepare yourself. The next phase will require precision and resolve.
We’ve narrowed it down. An anomaly in the Althes system, drift patterns, subspace echoes. It’s almost certainly a gate wreck, likely from Pioneer times.

Althes itself is unusual. It was overlooked during the original Terran expansion, only discovered long after the Pioneers vanished. No records. No reason. Someone altered its gate links long ago... and not by accident.
This whole sector’s a curiosity. No patrol records. No known habitation. Almost like it was erased from the map on purpose.
There it is... or what’s left of it. The architecture's definitely Terran. Old model, pre-Earth secession era. The core’s cracked open like an egg.
Blast patterns suggest an internal overload. This wasn’t an external hit, it was shut down from the inside. Deliberate. Controlled.
The signal's weak. We won’t get clean telemetry from inside the cockpit. You’ll need to EVA, get close and scan it manually.
Excellent work, Commander. We'll review the data and formulate our next steps. Stand by for further orders.
Commander, welcome back. We've reviewed your scans from the Althes wreck. Our engineers have successfully repaired the gate's structure, but there's a problem.
The routing matrix inside the gate's core is incomplete. We can't initialize a connection without a valid destination vector. If we guess wrong... well, let's just say it wouldn't end well.
This mission won't be easy. You'll be alone, deep in space, with no comm support if the jump fails. But if we're going to re-establish this corridor... this is our only option.
You're cleared for launch. Make it back with that data, Commander.
Commander, you'll need an Unfocused Jumpdrive to proceed — seek out to the Goners, they're your best lead.
Good work, Commander. The targeting data you recovered has been authenticated and cross-checked against the gate’s harmonics.
We’ve uploaded the coordinates to the Althes gate. Roe has confirmed the alignment is stable, we now have a clear path to whatever lies on the other side.
However, Command has decided not to activate the gate just yet. We need time to run full simulations, secure support assets, and prepare for whatever we might encounter.
You're free to stand down for now, Commander. Use this time to resupply or handle any outstanding assignments.
When we're ready to proceed with the gate activation, you'll be the first to know. Keep your channels open.
Good to have you with us, Commander. The team is ready to begin the mission. Rendezvous with us in Althes.
All right, Commander. The team is assembled and our jump formation is set.
This is a historic moment. We have authorization to proceed through the gate. Your ship will lead the group.
Once we're through, stay alert. We have no idea what condition the other side is in, or who might be waiting.
We're through. Scanners are online... It's quiet. Too quiet. Just a handful of structures, mining outposts, by the look of it.
We’ve got a lock on the signal — it's a gate, east of this sector. No need to return. Proceed through when you’re ready. We’ll follow your lead.
My god... it’s real. A whole world, alive and thriving. After all this time...
Commander, we've received word from Lt. Maera on Terra Nova. She has your next assignment ready. Proceed to Terra Nova and report to her at the Orbital Defence Station.

page.title: Argon/Terran Female Variation - Polly: US - Danielle
page.t: Do I look like Yaki? Cut it out!
I don't take kindly to your attention, pilot. Arming weapons.
Damage my wares and I'll be sure to damage yours.
Engaging attack vector, you're marked and sparked.
I'm taking damage! Request immediate assistance!
Chikusho! You're an ass!
Hey! I didn't mean it. Please stop!
Systems down, life-support failing!
Not like this! Noooo!
Confirmed!
Your targeting systems appear to be malfunctioning. Stand down!
Chikusho! Pilot, I have weapons locked! Final warning!
We're locked onto you. Ah, what a sweet tone!
What's biting you?
Is your brain-cell lonely again?
I'm fresh out of time, catch up later.
Sorry I can't give you data on that.
Not my call, pilot.
You may be cute, but you're all kinds of stupid!
Did you leave your brains in quarantine, pilot?
Shiny! A new target for testing my weapons!
Punching out. I'll find you..(cold)I swear I'll have my revenge.
Cargo's in the pipe. Now get bent!
You had better have a damn good reason for this call, pilot.
I'm about done talking, sweetcheeks. Not done fighting though.
Chikusho! I'm BUSY! No time for smalltalk!
Yeah, I'd like to help you, but that's not going to happen anytime soon.
Pilot, I fought the Kha'ak at Omicron Lyrae. Surrender? Never.
Set your waypoint for the
Pretty little thing, but clearly not the brightest. You're already there!
That doesn't register on my nav-charts. Sorry.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Pleased to help. Head towards the
Should you ever need anything else, you know where I'll be.
Everything's just fine - we'll start unloading here.
You're very welcome. I'm looking forward to doing business with you next time.
Sector Security, stop your engines and drop your wares!
I won't say this again, you're carrying illegals. Drop them or I fire.
This is Sector Security, you're in the clear. Enjoy your flight.
Chikusho! What is this, a pleasure-cruise? My ma flies faster than you!
I want the hell off this piece of junk, I'm punching out next stop.
Shiny! That freight would look great in my hold!
That's my baby. Come to mama.
Oh that's really not enough to satisfy me, (purrs)drop more, more...
Need a little covering fire, this one's got a little bite!
Nah, I want to see you shoot it out solo for once.
On my way!.. Chikusho! You talk too much and fight too little.
(laughter, throaty)
(laughter, throaty)
Chikusho, you're as ugly as you are stupid.
(curses)You fight like you want to die!
(greeting)Hey you.
(bye)Farewell.
(excuse)My bad.
Aiiieeeeehhh! (pronounced Ay-eee)
I can't thank you enough.
Over to the
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Marking hostiles! Rolling in!
They're coming in from all angles!
I'm under attack!
Taking fire! Shields going down!
Not good! Not good! Hull's being breached!
They're tied to my six. Can't break out!
Reactor's punching critical mass, she's going to blow!
I can't even count them! Too many!
Mark one up for the princess!
Burn baby, burn!
Take that!
I'd love to hear you scream my name as your ship burns.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
Thinning out! It would be a waste to end it here, like this.
This isn't working out how I thought it would. Dropping out!
There's a missile on me!
Missile has spiked, its got me!
(prefix to 803 )Perfect timing!
(prefix to 803 )Cutting things close, but you made it!
(prefix to 803 )Glad to hear from you.
There's work that might fit you well.
I'm looking for a combat veteran.
I need a ship, a good one.
I need someone to pick up some cargo for me.
(protection mission)I need someone to watch my six.
I'm in need of a freighter pilot.
Got a mark I need taken care of.
I've got a fare needing transport.
I'm looking to hitch a ride.
I need to get the frick' out of here, fast!.
I need someone capable of building a station for me.
I'm going to need you to deliver some wares.
I need a trace put out on someone.
I'm looking for someone willing to work for me.
Looks like I might be able to offer you something!
Can you assist me?
Are you interested?
Want to see the specs of the job?
You going to give me a green light on the job?
Patching through the information now.
Details coming through now
We're going to need these things.
This mission shouldn't be an issue for you.
This might make you sweat a little.
You might find things a little heavy.
This mission's short and sweet.
You're in for the long haul on this one.
You'll have hostiles en-route.
Watch your six for police during the mission.
Keep your head down and watch for enemies on this mission.
Excellent, no way I would have done it without you.
You did good here, real good.
Your help made all the difference.
Thanks again, you're pretty much my number one!
I guess that will have to do. Need to try a little harder though.
Wiring your money through to you now.
You suck, badly. Get the hell out out of here!
Abort! (disgusted)Abort! This mission is over.
Hey!? Where d'you think you're going? We're not done here!
Take a look at your guidance system, pilot!
You're coming up short on the ticker, move it!
Timer's out. You're out.
What gives!? You've lost it! Completely lost it!
No can do, I need someone with experience.
You'll need a ship hardened for combat for this.
Got to have a transport ship for this one.
Jumpdrive's essential for this.
Transporter device is essential for this.
Head off and get one!
Ports locked down, I'm onboard.
Take us out!
See that thruster control? Why won't you frickin' use it?
Let me out of this hunk of junk!
Thanks for getting me here safely!
I may be small, but are you crazy? I can't fit onboard!
You think I'm going to hold my breath? Get a cargo life support system!
No way - you either get a passenger transport or the deal is off.
Shipment received, thank you!
We need more. Awaiting further deliveries.
I've seen Goner better prepared. Get some equipment.
Your wares are being transferred.
You think this is okay? Look at me! It is NOT okay! Chikusho!
Mark your intercept course and clear out all hostiles.
Drop back! Regroup at our command base!
Punching through and weapons free. Reinforcement have arrived!
Shiny! Additional firepower heading in through the (gate)
Well, if it ain't the cavalry! Great to have you with us!
Heads up, people! Enemy ships heading in through the (gate)
Shiny! Push through to base for any repairs you need.
Hold this position.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Stay on my six!
Stop your grinnin' and drop your linen! We got incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Set intercept vector! Move in!
We have mines in range, evasive manoeuvres!
Stay frosty. We'll need cover.
What are you, nuts? You're out of space. Drop some cargo.
You'll need to dock here so I can deliver the wares you require.
I don't want this out in the open. Dock and we'll deliver the data.
Great! You've got the ship! Dock over here!
Is there a reason you're taking your time? Get it done!
Make your approach and dock.
You don't have range yet, push forwards a little!
Proximity alert! Punch back! Now!
Sorry, there's nothing lined up for you right now.
You honour us with your loyal service. We wish to reward you for your efforts.
Sector Security here. You appear to be carrying an illegal passenger. We demand immediate release or we'll take action!
Please come back later if you have a change of heart.
That's not something you want to repeat!
Hey, don't worry. Have another try.
Good work! You did it!
Excellent!
That's the way to do it!
Why are you following me?
These are the prices.
Greetings, cadet. The Spacelab Headquarters is loaded and ready for deployment. Just let me know where you would like it to be positioned.
I hear you've been seeking a meeting with the Beryll. What can we assist you with?

Yes, we’re aware of these incidents. However, it’s not the Beryll behind them. A splinter faction broke away from Mists of Artemis to establish their own group. They’re the ones responsible for the incursions, and we want to put an end to their activities.

Unfortunately, we don’t have that information. We know they’ve discovered a hidden sector and are using it as their base, but its location remains unknown. What we do know is that they’ve been experimenting with wormholes, and the sector is likely accessible only through one of these portals.

No, the wormhole to Mists of Artemis is one of the few stable ones. However, there are many unstable wormholes with shifting entry and exit points. It's likely that one end of the wormhole is anchored in their new sector, while the other end moves unpredictably. I’m sure they have a method for tracking its location.
We had our suspicions, and we’re eager to assist. We’re willing to offer our support to the Argon Secret Service. Could you arrange a meeting to discuss the next steps?
Yes, I’m Yvona Jovi from the Beryll, here to offer my assistance.
We’re sending you the information we have on wormholes and recent sightings. Hopefully, your team can glean more insights from it.
All we request is that, once the faction is dealt with, we retain ownership of their sector.
I've arrived in Argon space to offer my assistance with this issue. This faction poses a threat to all of us.
They were expelled from the Mists of Artemis because of their extreme beliefs.
We view the Xenon as fascinating technology to study, but they took their experiments too far and began worshiping them as gods
That won’t be easy. We haven’t been able to locate them yet, but we suspect they might have a hidden sector somewhere.
As you know, our home is concealed behind a wormhole. We believe their sector is similarly hidden, though likely behind a more unstable wormhole, which is why we haven’t been able to locate it.
We've been conducting experiments with wormholes, so it's possible they've advanced this technology and may have equipment to detect or even control wormholes.
We'll share all our data on wormholes with your scientists.
I'm picking up something on my scanners, over to the west.
There they are
I'm not picking up any signals here, sir.
Still no readings on my scanners, sir.
Hold on, I’m picking up something to the North East.

page.title: Argon/Terran female Variation: Polly: US - Joanna
page.t: I'd better be in your sights for a reason, pilot. Stand down!
You're close to finding yourself in a world of pain.
You think I travel alone or unguarded? Think again.
I'm done talking, pilot. Not done fighting though. Hell no!
I'm under fire! Under fire! Need fighter support!
I'll spread your ashes across the sectors!
Systems failing, you gotta give me a chance!
I'm breaking apart here! Stand down! Stand down!
Can't breathe! (strangled cries)Eaaahhh!
Understood!
If you're looking for a fight, keep pushing, pilot.
You're flying on borrowed time. Don't force me to give the order!
I'm weapons-free. Attack vector set.
Got something to say, pilot?
Do I look like I frickin' care? Bite me!
Not able to deal with you now, patch in to me another time.
That's not something I can help with.
Not my jurisdiction. Sorry!
You want me to what? You're kidding right? Am I on a CamShow?!
Say again. I was laughing so hard I missed that last part.
Those better not be scorch-marks on my hull!
Take her! Just get the hell off my six! I'm done fighting!
Cargo coming your way. Now break it off!
Force Commander online. What do you require?
Sweet-talk all you want, you'll be smouldering fire when I'm done.
No time. Leave your ID; if you're cute, I'll check in later.
You're going to have to figure that out on your own.
You would be wise to watch your mouth, my patience wears thin.
You'll need to set up a vector for the
It looks like you're already there. Been on the space fuel again?
I haven't got a clue where you're talking about, sorry!
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Your reputation precedes you, we will direct you towards the
You honour me with your presence.
This is Sector Patrol, your cargo is hot! Drop the illegals now!
Arming weapons, comply or you will be fired upon!
Scans confirm you're clean and good to go. Thank you for your cooperation.
Don't care how long you keep me onboard, neeeeever gonna happen.
That's quite enough, I'm done flying with you.
Let me lighten your load a little. Drop your shields and let's party.
That's a start. Now show me a little more, sweetcheeks.
(cold)I don't want to have to hurt you.. so drop the wares, (hard)NOW!
Oh great! Now you decide to fight back! Calling for support!
Really don't think so. This one's all yours.
Setting intercept course. I'm on the way.
(laughter)
(laughter)
Is that your ship exhaust or your breath!?
You're nothing more than a weedhead.
(greeting)Good to see you, pilot!
(bye, spoken warmly,softly)See you on the other side...
Didn't mean that! Standing down.
Hraaaaaarh!
I have been blessed, thank you.
Over to
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Hostiles locked! Engaging targets!
My ship's taking a hammering.
I'm under attack! Can't shake 'em!
My shields won't hold out!
I'm taking hull damage!
They're on my six, can't shake them!!
Reactor's reaching critical, about to blow!
They're too many for me!
Now that's what I call a kill!
You ain't all that!
Reap the whirlwind. Reap it.
I'll bring you to your knees and make you beg for your life.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
(fleeing)You're too cute to kill and I'm too hot to die. Bugging out.
(fleeing)You're crazy! Frickin' crazy! I'm gone!
Got a mike on my six!
This missile's got a solid tone on me!
(prefix to 803 )Great timing!
(prefix to 803 )Ah! What fortunate timing.
(prefix to 803 )I'm so happy to speak to you.
I have a job that's perfect for you.
I need someone who knows how to handle a ship and weaponry.
I need a ship, tough and fast.
I'm looking for a courier to bring me some wares.
I need a wingman, strictly protection and cover.
Looking for someone who can handle a freighter.
I need someone taken care of, (pronounced capeesh)capisce?
I've got a passenger in need of a ride.
I need to hitch a ride with someone, reckon you could take me?
You have to get me out of here, fast! Please, I need a ride!
I've been looking for someone to build me a station. You got the gear?
I'm going to need you to ship some items.
I need a bio-lock on someone... I want a confirmed find.
Hey I'm looking for someone to work for me, think you could stick it?
Yes, I've got something you can do.
I'm in need of a little help here.
Would you be interested?
D'you want to take a run through the details?
Stop gawking! You want the job or not?
Sending through the data now.
Sending full details now.
Here's the itinerary. This is what we need.
You'll walk through this no problem.
There might be a few bumps on this one.
You're going to take some heat on this mission.
You'll be done before starfall.
You won't be done with this for a while, have patience.
You'll have enemies on the lookout for you during this mission.
Check your six for police during this mission.
Check your six for enemies during this mission.
Amazing! Wouldn't have closed this one out without you!
You make me proud, real proud! Great work!
Thanks for your help with this one!
Great! Your work is without fault, as usual.
I reckon that will have to do. Make a little more effort next time?
Dispatching your payment now.
What the hell was that? You failed. Get the hell out of my sight.
Aborting! This mission is over, moron!
Great! I have a damn coward on my hands! That's it! You BETTER run!
Take a look through your charts, pilot!
You're on the clock and it's running down fast!
Shoot, that's it. You're through, out of time.
Think that's funny!? That's coming straight out of your pay!
Nothing happening! I want someone with stones.
You need a fully-prepped combat ship for this.
You need a fully-prepped transporter for this.
You'll need a jumpdrive for this mission.
Without a transporter device, nothing happening.
Go grab yourself one!
(Passenger on board)Okay, I'm secure!
(Passenger on board)Punch it! Get me where I want to be!
We're losing precious time here! Get there already!
I'm through with this, let me off your ship.
We made it! Thanks for the ride!
There's no way I'm going to fit in your hold!
Do I look like Xenon? Get a cargo life support system!
What? You want me to fly with you in that? Get a passenger transport!
Your delivery is confirmed. Great work!
Still need more. Awaiting further shipments.
Your ship's a little empty. Grab some equipment.
Your goods are being transferred.
What happened here? You think this is in any way acceptable? Think again.
Set your intercept vector and neutralise all hostiles.
We need to regroup! Fall back and head for the Command Base!
Someone call for a little extra fire? Light 'em up, we'll put 'em out.
Great! We have more ships punching in through the (gate)
Really glad to have you with us!
Make like you've got a plan! Enemy ships inbound through the (gate)
Great job! Move to base and get your repairs.
Hold here. Await further orders.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Follow my lead!
Whole heap of pain coming our way, incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Mark intercept. Punch in now!
Mines in sector, watch your vector!
I'll need your protection. Watch my six.
Unload some wares, you're out of space.
I can't deliver your cargo until you're docked.
You won't get anything until you're docked. I'll deliver the data when I see you.
Amazing! You have the ship! Dock it at this station please!
Is there something you're waiting for? Get on with it!
Lay in an approach vector and dock your ship, pilot.
You're out too far, move in a little closer!
Push back! You're in too deep!
I'm out of leads, pilot. Nothing, nada, zilch! Now scram!
Your efforts have not gone unnoticed. Please accept this reward.
Sector Security here. An unregistered passenger has been detected on your ship. Release him or we'll take action.
Come back and see me if you have a rethink.
Stop that right now!
Try again. Really, it's not a problem.
Well done, that's it!
Outstanding!
Chikusho! Now that's how you do it!
I suggest you stop following me!
Displaying the prices now.

Greetings hunter, glad you could join us. As you know, we aim to claim this sector for the Guild. To achieve this, we need to employ diplomacy. Your first task is to send your agent to register our interest in the sector.

To claim a sector, you need to send one of your agents to a Privateer dock. The Privateer Independence Alliance oversees the ownership of new sectors and mediates the claiming process between various factions.
Hunter, we received confirmation of the sector claim, well done.
Next, we need to earn some favour to improve our chances of claiming the sector. There are several Yaki ships in the area, clear them out.
Excellent, that should significantly boost our standing among the other claimants.
To monitor your progress, you can use diplomacy to check the current status of the sector. Try that now to see how our competition is doing.

It seems we have some competition for the sector, and they're already in the advanced stages of their claims. Our best chance might be to persuade them to drop their claim, as catching up doesn't seem feasible.
First, focus on the Paranid. Use diplomacy to persuade them to drop their claim. You may need to get friendly and earn some diplomatic bonuses before you can proceed.
It seems the Paranid have withdrawn their claim, making things easier for us now.
To strengthen our claim, let's work on persuading the Argon to support us.
That support will definitely bolster our claim.

Next, let's turn our attention to the Split. I've contacted our guild associates and they persuaded the Split to consider dropping their claim. However, they have a task for us to complete before they agree.
Excellent, I have received word about the Split dropping their claim.

The only obstacle left is the pirates. I've tried reaching out, but they haven't responded. We'll need to take a different approach. Your mission is to do what you do best, assassinate several key pirate leaders until they’re persuaded.
Well done, assassin. The sector is now under our control, and we can begin relocating our operations. Thank you for all your assistance.

I'm Specialist Roe. I've seen telemetry like this before, buried deep in black-site archives. References to an early colonization project, the 'Terran Pioneers.' They left Earth to establish independent settlements beyond the gate network, before the Terraformers went rogue.
We'll need more than Terran resources. There are alien experts who’ve studied ancient gate phenomena. I’ve compiled a shortlist.

There is Dr. Gululu Bo, a Boron researcher in xenophysics. High Deacon Ramanckosset of the Paranid, who holds... unusual views. And Mira Selis, an exiled Argon scientist with a past in piracy. I will send you the details of where to find them.
That’s right. I’ve verified some of the signal protocols. The design architecture is consistent with the earliest Terran deep-space expeditionary ships.
Some of this aligns with old models we only had theories about. These ships didn’t come from anywhere in our known jump network.
I believe we’re dealing with remnants from the Lost Colonies, the Terran Pioneers who were sent to explore and settle beyond the frontier before the gate collapse.
If they survived, they might still be out there. Isolated. Self-reliant. Possibly advanced in ways we can't predict.
The cut gate could explain why no one’s heard from them for so long, they severed the connection to protect themselves... maybe from the Xenon.
The data is complex and fragmented. We’ll need time to fully analyze the findings and extract usable coordinates.
Come back later, once we’ve processed the information. Until then, stand by for further orders.
Telemetry confirms a fractured jump gate core. It’s faint, but still transmitting residual data. If the nav buffer survived, we might find where it once connected.
Get in close, run a deep scan, and bring the results home. We need to know whether the Pioneers shut themselves off, or if something forced their hand.
Data received. You got closer than I expected. Impressive work, pilot.
The gate core was breached from within, controlled overload confirmed. This wasn't an accident. Someone shut it down with precision.
What’s more… I’ve isolated a decayed coordinate string. It’s degraded, but I can partially reconstruct where this gate used to connect.
We’ll need to run deeper analysis back at Saturn. Bring the scan logs and telemetry in as soon as you’re ready.

Based on your data, I managed to isolate a faint signal encoded in the wreck's residual harmonics. It points to what we believe was once a Pioneer relay station, located deep beyond the mapped jump network.
It's not a colony, as far as we can tell. More likely, a waystation, a place used to recalibrate or redirect long-range jumps between frontier sectors.

We’ll need someone to jump there and retrieve the original targeting data. I’ve modified your Unfocused Jumpdrive with a custom seed based on the signal. With luck, it’ll land you close enough to begin a search.
Frankly, I didn’t expect the relay to still be functional after all this time. The data signature was degraded, but recoverable, just barely.
This confirms the Pioneers were deliberately creating long-range corridor chains, likely to isolate themselves from the Xenon threat. If so... the next sector could hold far more than we anticipated.
I’ll continue reviewing the data until then. Something tells me we’re only scratching the surface of what the Pioneers built.
I still can't believe we’ve come this far. This gate matches the engineering signatures of early Pioneer teams — we’re about to uncover a piece of Terran history sealed away for centuries.
No active comms traffic. Power readings are minimal. These stations haven't seen maintenance in decades... maybe centuries.
Atmosphere is stable, orbital infrastructure is operational, and... I’m reading active IFF signatures. This colony never died.

page.title: Argon/Terran Female Variation: Polly - SA - Ayanda
page.t: Do I look like Yaki? Cut it out!
I don't take kindly to your attention, pilot. Arming weapons.
Damage my wares and I'll be sure to damage yours.
Engaging attack vector, you're marked and sparked.
I'm taking damage! Request immediate assistance!
Chikusho! You're an ass!
Hey! I didn't mean it. Please stop!
Systems down, life-support failing!
Not like this! Noooo!
Confirmed!
Your targeting systems appear to be malfunctioning. Stand down!
Chikusho! Pilot, I have weapons locked! Final warning!
We're locked onto you. Ah, what a sweet tone!
Can I help with something?
Is your brain-cell lonely again?
I'm fresh out of time, catch up later.
Sorry I can't give you data on that.
Not my call, pilot.
You may be cute, but you're all kinds of stupid!
Did you leave your brains in quarantine, pilot?
Shiny! A new target for testing my weapons!
Punching out. I'll find you..(cold)I swear I'll have my revenge.
Cargo's in the pipe. Now get bent!
You had better have a damn good reason for this call, pilot.
I'm about done talking, sweetcheeks. Not done fighting though.
Chikusho! I'm BUSY! No time for smalltalk!
Yeah, I'd like to help you, but that's not going to happen anytime soon.
Pilot, I fought the Kha'ak at Omicron Lyrae. Surrender? Never.
Set your waypoint for the
Pretty little thing, but clearly not the brightest. You're already there!
That doesn't register on my nav-charts. Sorry.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Pleased to help. Head towards the
Should you ever need anything else, you know where I'll be.
Sector Security, stop your engines and drop your wares!
I won't say this again, you're carrying illegals. Drop them or I fire.
This is Sector Security, you're in the clear. Enjoy your flight.
Chikusho! What is this, a pleasure-cruise? My ma flies faster than you!
I want the hell off this piece of junk, I'm punching out next stop.
Shiny! That freight would look great in my hold!
That's my baby. Come to mama.
Oh that's really not enough to satisfy me, (purrs)drop more, more...
Need a little covering fire, this one's got a little bite!
Nah, I want to see you shoot it out solo for once.
On my way!.. Chikusho! You talk too much and fight too little.
(laughter, throaty)
(laughter, throaty)
Chikusho, you're as ugly as you are stupid.
(curses)You fight like you want to die!
(greeting)Hey you.
(bye)Farewell.
(excuse)My bad.
Aiiieeeeehhh! (pronounced Ay-eee)
I can't thank you enough.
Over to the
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Marking hostiles! Rolling in!
They're coming in from all angles!
I'm under attack!
Taking fire! Shields going down!
Not good! Not good! Hull's being breached!
They're tied to my six. Can't break out!
Reactor's punching critical mass, she's going to blow!
I can't even count them! Too many!
Mark one up for the princess!
Burn baby, burn!
Take that!
I'd love to hear you scream my name as your ship burns.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
Thinning out! It would be a waste to end it here, like this.
This isn't working out how I thought it would. Dropping out!
There's a missile on me!
Missile has spiked, its got me!
(prefix to 803 )Perfect timing!
(prefix to 803 )Cutting things close, but you made it!
(prefix to 803 )Glad to hear from you.
There's work that might fit you well.
I'm looking for a combat veteran.
I need a ship, a good one.
I need someone to pick up some cargo for me.
(protection mission)I need someone to watch my six.
I'm in need of a freighter pilot.
Got a mark I need taken care of.
I've got a fare needing transport.
I'm looking to hitch a ride.
I need to get the frick' out of here, fast!.
I need someone capable of building a station for me.
I'm going to need you to deliver some wares.
I need a trace put out on someone.
I'm looking for someone willing to work for me.
Looks like I might be able to offer you something!
Can you assist me?
Are you interested?
Want to see the specs of the job?
You going to give me a green light on the job?
Patching through the information now.
Details coming through now
We're going to need these things.
This mission shouldn't be an issue for you.
This might make you sweat a little.
You might find things a little heavy.
This mission's short and sweet.
You're in for the long haul on this one.
You'll have hostiles en-route.
Watch your six for police during the mission.
Keep your head down and watch for enemies on this mission.
Excellent, no way I would have done it without you.
You did good here, real good.
Your help made all the difference.
Thanks again, you're pretty much my number one!
I guess that will have to do. Need to try a little harder though.
Wiring your money through to you now.
You suck, badly. Get the hell out out of here!
Abort! (disgusted)Abort! This mission is over.
Hey!? Where d'you think you're going? We're not done here!
Take a look at your guidance system, pilot!
You're coming up short on the ticker, move it!
Timer's out. You're out.
What gives!? You've lost it! Completely lost it!
No can do, I need someone with experience.
You'll need a ship hardened for combat for this.
Got to have a transport ship for this one.
Jumpdrive's essential for this.
Transporter device is essential for this.
Head off and get one!
Ports locked down, I'm onboard.
Take us out!
See that thruster control? Why won't you frickin' use it?
Let me out of this hunk of junk!
Thanks for getting me here safely!
I may be small, but are you crazy? I can't fit onboard!
You think I'm going to hold my breath? Get a cargo life support system!
No way - you either get a passenger transport or the deal is off.
Shipment received, thank you!
We need more. Awaiting further deliveries.
I've seen Goner better prepared. Get some equipment.
Your wares are being transferred.
You think this is okay? Look at me! It is NOT okay! Chikusho!
Mark your intercept course and clear out all hostiles.
Drop back! Regroup at our command base!
Punching through and weapons free. Reinforcement have arrived!
Shiny! Additional firepower heading in through the (gate)
Well, if it ain't the cavalry! Great to have you with us!
Heads up, people! Enemy ships heading in through the (gate)
Shiny! Push through to base for any repairs you need.
Hold this position.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Stay on my six!
Stop your grinnin' and drop your linen! We got incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Set intercept vector! Move in!
We have mines in range, evasive manoeuvres!
Stay frosty. We'll need cover.
What are you, nuts? You're out of space. Drop some cargo.
You'll need to dock here so I can deliver the wares you require.
I don't want this out in the open. Dock and we'll deliver the data.
Great! You've got the ship! Dock over here!
Is there a reason you're taking your time? Get it done!
Make your approach and dock.
You don't have range yet, push forwards a little!
Proximity alert! Punch back! Now!
Sorry, there's nothing lined up for you right now.
You honour us with your loyal service. We wish to reward you for your efforts.
Sector Security here. You appear to be carrying an illegal passenger. We demand immediate release or we'll take action!
Please come back later if you have a change of heart.
That's not something you want to repeat!
Hey, don't worry. Have another try.
Good work! You did it!
Excellent!
That's the way to do it!
Why are you following me?
These are the prices.
I am Jennaia of the Yaki, i've heard you may be interested in joining us?

As it turns out, we're in need of skilled pilots to assist us. Our smuggling operations have encountered some obstacles recently—the Paranid have deployed new scanner technology that can penetrate our cargo bay shielding. We need to put an end to this. If you can join our escorts and help protect them, you might have to get your hands dirty with the Paranid.
Ok pilot, meet us in Priest Refuge
Glad you could join us, pilot. We’re about to start the escort, and we’re anticipating some trouble along the way, so stay alert.
Phew, we made it here, lets meet at the local station.
We are just on our way to Unseen domain with a shipment of Ore, we don't want any trouble
This doesn't look good pilot, prepare for trouble.
Go to hell Paranid scum!!
Pilot, Attack them, we need to allow the freighter to make their escape.
Looks like we were right about their new scanners, this is troubling indeed. We are almost there, just need to get to the next sector.
Welcome to Anacreon's Kingdom. These sectors are part of our new territory, claimed when the gates shifted, much to the frustration of the Paranid.
Lets carry on pilot, hopefully the rest of the journey will be uneventful.
This sector is swarming with border patrol ships; stick close to the freighter.
Yes, thank you for your help, pilot. You are now a friend of the Yaki. There are more tasks available if you're interested. Good luck out there.
You can find various tasks in Yaki space; complete them, and we can arrange a meeting with our leaders.
Unidentified vessel, you are entering Pioneer sovereign space. This region is under isolation mandate. State your intentions immediately.
Earth? That... is not possible. Earth was lost to us. We've had no contact in centuries.
You claim to be from Earth, and now a diplomatic envoy? This is hard to accept.
But... we are not in a position to dismiss help. Our food reserves are in decline. Infrastructure is failing. If this is not a trick, then perhaps... there is reason to talk.
I will escort you to our orbital defence station. There, we will speak further under Council oversight.
Welcome aboard, Envoy. I speak on behalf of the Pioneer Council and our people. This day... was never expected.
For generations, we've known only silence. The stars beyond our gates were stories, warnings, even. And now Earth stands before us once more.
You must understand, many among us will not welcome you. Isolation became our identity. But... survival must come first.
Then let us take this first step together. Supplies will be received here at the Orbital Defence Station. I’ll coordinate the intake directly.
Help us survive this winter, and perhaps, in time, we will begin to trust again.
Commander, our food reserves are nearly gone. We've rationed what little we have, but children and the elderly are already suffering. If Earth can send anything, anything at all, we need it now.

Thank you again for the food. But now the clinics are reporting equipment failures, and the power grid is fluctuating across the colony. Our medical and environmental systems won’t hold much longer without support.

Our mainframe clusters are failing. Too many years of patchwork repairs and hand-built circuit boards. We need fresh components, microchips, computer components, anything. If we can't restore the control systems, everything else falls apart.
That shipment was a lifesaver. Our systems are finally stabilizing, for the first time in years, we're not just surviving, we're rebuilding. You've given us a second chance, Commander.
Commander, it’s good to see you again. I hope the quiet has been treating you well, because that’s about to change.
You remember the damaged gate in this sector? For years, we’ve considered it beyond repair. The Pioneers simply didn’t have the resources or the means to restore it.

After speaking with Earth’s representatives, we believe there may be a solution. The gate’s subspace alignment chamber requires a crystalline matrix, something we’ve been unable to produce since the days of the early colonists.
Yes. A very specific type of Terran energy crystal used to channel subspace energy and stabilize wormhole flow. Without it, the gate’s core remains dormant.
They do, though access to them is… complicated. They’re controlled materials, used only for deep-space gate research and Trans-Orbital Accelerator calibration.

The Terran Envoy, Daichi Tsu, believes the United Space Command may be willing to assist if the request comes through you. You’ve proven yourself trustworthy, Commander. We’d like you to be the one to secure the crystals.
Excellent. Once we have the crystals, our engineers will begin restoring the gate immediately. If this works… it will be the first time in centuries a Pioneer-built gate reactivates.
Commander, we’re all set. Join me by the gate so we can start the activation sequence.
All preparations are complete. It’s your moment, Commander — EVA and bring our gate back to life.
Energy levels are spiking, the gate is coming online! Commander, pull back to a safe distance.
It’s happening, Commander, energy readings are off the scale!

page.title: Argon/Terran Male - Polly - US - Patrick
page.t: What the hell do you think you are doing?
I suggest you leave me alone or you'll be sleeping with the spaceflies!
Keep that up and you'll regret it!
Don't say I didn't tell you so! You'd better run and hide!
Someone! Please help! I'm being attacked!
You got the flying skills of a large asteroid!
For pity's sake!
Argh, I can't take much more of this!
I'll see you on the other side! Arrrgh!
Yep!
Guess the odds of you winning this... Yep, you lose!
We won't warn you again. Next time you die!
Don't say you weren't warned!
Can I help you with something?
Don't you have a sun to fly into?
You picked a bad time, sorry.
You're confusing me with someone who cares.
Sorry, not my problem.
Surrender?! Don't make me laugh.
Is this your stupid idea of a joke?
It's a good day to die!
OK, I give up, I'm punching out... Take the ship!
Here, take this freight and leave me in peace.
Bridge Commander speaking. State your business.
Oh, you want to talk now, do you? Unlucky!
No time to stop and chat; find someone else to annoy.
You must have a comm problem, talk to someone else.
Suh-ren-der?.. That's my line, so get out of here before you die.
No problem, look near the
Take a look around, wiseguy... You're there!
Sorry, I'm not from around here.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
You just need to fly through the
Glad to be of assistance.
You appear to be carrying contraband. Jettison them or face the consequences.
We won't tell you again. Drop the illegal goods.
No contraband is indicated on our scans. Thanks for your patience.
Notice any extra oxygen consumption on board recently?(sarcastic)
I won't put up with this any longer. Let me off!
That freight has my name on it. Drop it or regret it.
You're more clever than you look.
Now you've tested the release mechanism, drop the rest!
Heeelp! Someone help me deal with this idiot.
You're doing a great job there... I'll just watch.
OK. Help is on the way.
(laughter)
(laughter)
(curses)Damn oxygen thief!
(curses)Drink plasma!
(greeting)Hey there.
(bye)So long!
(excuse)I beg your pardon.
(pain)Ooof!
(thanks)Much obliged.
Over to the
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Rolling in to engage the enemy!
I'm being roasted here!
(Under attack)...being fried!
Shields are going down!
My hull is being pummelled!
I can't lose them!
The main reactor is just about to go!
There's too many bogeys!
Yay! Notch one for me!
Got it!
Take this!
How about a space dust diet?
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
(fleeing)I'm making a run for it!
(fleeing)Time to get out of here!
I've got an inbound missile!
It's locked on me; the missile has a lock!
(prefix to 803 )Good timing!
(prefix to 803 )Ah! Just in time.
(prefix to 803 )Glad you called.
(generic job)I've got something that might interest you then.
(combat mission)I'm looking for a fighter pilot.
(I need a ship)I need a ship.
(I need some wares)I'm looking for someone to pick up some stuff for me.
(protection mission)I need some protection.
I'm looking for a freighter pilot.
(assassination)I need someone taken care of.
(transport)I've got a passenger needing transport.
(transport)I need a ride.
(urgent transport)I need to get out of here, fast.
I need someone to build me a station.
(NPC wants some wares or ships)We need you to deliver some items.
I need to find someone.
I'm looking for someone to work for me.
