Yeah, I've got another job for you.
I need help.
Does that interest you?
Do you want to see the details?
Do you want the job?
Transmitting information now.
Sending details now.
This is what we need...
This mission should be easy.
This might be a bit tricky.
This might prove a hard mission.
This mission should not take too long.
This job might take a while.
You should expect enemies on the way.
Watch out for police during the mission.
Watch out for enemies during the mission.
Thanks, couldn't have done it without you.
(Mission Complete)You did a great job!
(Mission Complete)Thanks for your assistance.
(Mission Complete, recurring)Thanks, great work as usual.
(Mission Complete, could be better)Ok, that will do. Could have been better though.
(paying player)Transferring your money now.
(Mission Failed)That was terrible! Get out of here!
(Mission Failed Mid Mission)This mission is over!
(player running away)Where are you going?
(Guidance Hint)Check your guidance.
(Time Update)You're running out of time.
(Time Update)That's it. You're out of time.
(offensive action against mission object or actor)What are you doing??
Sorry, I wanted an experienced pilot.
You need a combat ship for this.
You need a transport ship for this.
You're going to need a jumpdrive.
You'll need a transporter device.
Go get yourself one!
(Passenger on board)Okay, I'm onboard.
(Passenger on board)Now get me to my destination!
Get a move on!
Let me disembark.
(Passenger getting off)Thanks for the ride!
I can't fit onboard that!
(No life support)You need a cargo life support system to transport passengers!
(passenger wont slum it in a fighter)I'm not getting on that, get a Passenger Transport.
(delivery brought)Delivery received.
(More deliveries required)Awaiting further deliveries.
(Ship has no equipment)Get some equipment installed.
Transferring wares now!
(something is wrong)What do you call this?
Intercept and destroy all hostile ships!
Fall back and regroup at Command!
(reinforcements arriving)Thought we'd drop by to clear up your mess.
Reinforcements arriving through the (gate)
(reinforcements have arrived)Glad to see you.
Enemy ships inbound through the (gate)
Good work, pilot. Proceed to base for repairs.
Hold this position.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Follow my lead!
We've got incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Move to intercept!
Watch out for those mines!
(Transport to player)Watch our back.
(cargo bay full)You need to clear some cargo space.
(want player to dock to get wares)Dock here so I can transfer the wares.
(want player to dock to get info)Not safe to transmit this openly, dock here and I'll send the data.
(player got ship for npc)Dock it here then.
What are you waiting for? Get on with it!
(generic dock request)You need to dock.
(distance guidance)You need to get close.
(distance guidance, panicked. Could be a hostile or concerned guide)Get away from it!
(no missions available)Nah, not got anything for you.
(reward for continued service)Your continued service to us cannot go unrewarded. We insist you accept this token of our appreciation.
Our scans reveal you are carrying an illegal passenger. Release this person immediately.
Okay, come back later if you change your mind.
Please stop that!
That's okay. Try again.
Good! You've got it.
Very good!
That's the way!
Are you following me?
Here are the prices.
Terracorp is looking for someone to work for us.
Would you like to do some work for Terracorp?
Terracorp would like you accept this token of our appreciation for your continued service.
Please accept this as a token of Terracorp's appreciation of your service.
Jonferco are looking for someone to do some work for us.
Would you like to work for Jonferco?
Please accept this as a reward for your continued service to Jonferco.
Jonferco would like to offer you this for your continued service.
OTAS(speak Oh-Tass) are looking for someone like you to work for us.
OTAS can offer you work.
Your continued service to OTAS is recognised with this gift.
OTAS offers you this for your continued service.
Plutarch is looking for someone to work for us.
Plutarch has some work for a pilot like you.
Please accept this from Plutarch in recognition of your loyal service.
Plutarch offers you this gift for your continued service.

Sharp eye—you caught that, huh? No, I’m not. Despite their reputation for being insular, Industritech has been expanding for some time now, recruiting members from other races. Talent matters more to them than bloodlines these days.

I intend to infiltrate several Terran stations to dig up anything I can find on gate technology. Rumors suggest they guard some valuable knowledge on the subject. But to get in, I’ll need you to transport me there. You’ll handle the flying—I’ll handle the snooping.

Don’t worry, I’ve got credentials that will get me through the door—at least initially. The real danger starts once I begin digging. That’s why I need you nearby. If things go south, you’ll be my way out.
Good. Let’s move quickly—the Terrans don’t take kindly to uninvited guests.
Alright, I’ve got what I need, let’s get out of here before they start getting suspicious.
Thanks for bringing me back. I'll analyze the data I collected and contact you soon with the results.
I’ve got another task for you, come speak with me when you’re available.
We've been piecing together the data on gate technology, but we're missing a crucial component. Since we can't produce it ourselves, we're going to have to steal it.

Hopefully not, but how you obtain it is up to you. We believe several ships may be carrying a special crystal. My recommendation is to acquire a Cargo Bay Hacker from the Dukes and attempt to steal it from one of those vessels. It would also help to get a Terran Police License, this will allow you to scan ships without drawing unwanted attention.
That's it, you've got it! Now hurry and bring it back to me.
Thank you, pilot, you’ve done an excellent job. This will be a tremendous help to us. We’ll reach out again once we’re ready to proceed. Until then, good hunting out there.
Ah, Commander! I'm thrilled you're joining us. Everything's in place, we'll be heading through the gate shortly.
Can you imagine? An entire Terran colony, cut off for centuries, just waiting to be rediscovered! This could be the beginning of a whole new chapter for both our peoples.
Of course, I’m sure they’ll welcome us with open arms. After all, who wouldn’t want to reconnect with home?
This can't be it. The Pioneers built entire colonies. Where is everyone?
They didn’t just survive, they built something beautiful. We’re looking at a living piece of Terran history.
This is Envoy Daichi Tsu of the United Space Command. We come in peace, with the full support of Earth’s leadership.
We’ve searched a long time for you. We wish only to open dialogue and offer assistance where we can.
Lt. Maera, your words are understood. The USC comes not to dominate, but to reconnect, and to assist where we can.
Our records of the Pioneers ended with the gate collapse. Your survival is nothing short of remarkable. And now, your situation is clear.
Our commanders have authorized an aid initiative. Humanitarian shipments are already being organized.
Commander, the Pioneer colony is in dire need. We've authorized immediate humanitarian support. Assist Lt. Maera in coordinating the first supply drops. Earth is counting on you to make this right.

Commander, you've done more here than we could have asked for. The people of Terra Nova are no longer starving, they're planning for the future. For now, stand down. We'll remain on station to continue our work. We'll call when the next step is ready.

page.title: Argon/Terran Female - Polly - Aus - Olivia
page.t: Do I seem like a Yaki to you? Back off!
Careful, pilot. I don’t appreciate the heat. Weapons online.
Touch my cargo and I’ll return the favor, with interest.
Locking in attack vector. You're tagged and lit up.
Shields dropping! I need support, now!
You absolute jerk!
Wait! I was kidding—stand down, please!
Critical failure! Life support’s crashing!
This can’t be it! Nooooo!
Copy that!
Your targeting’s off, pilot. Disengage, now!
Bastu! I’ve got you in my sights—this is your last chance!
Target acquired. Love that lock-on!
What’s your malfunction?
You running solo on neurons again?
No time, catch you on the flip.
Can’t help you there, no data.
Above my pay grade, pilot.
Charming face, empty cockpit upstairs!
Forget your brain at docking bay security again?
Perfect! A fresh target for my arsenal!
I’m bailing... but mark me, I’ll be back for you.
Goods ejected. Now shove off!
This better be important, or you're wasting my time.
Talk’s over, darling. Fight’s still on.
Bastu! I’ve got my hands full! Save it!
Sure, I’d love to help, right after never.
I faced the Kha'ak at Omicron Lyrae. You think you scare me?
Plot a course to the
Cute, but clueless, you’re already at the spot!
Not showing up on my maps, no can do.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Happy to assist. Move toward the
Need anything else? You know where to find me.
This is Sector Security! Engines down, cargo out, now!
Final warning, dump the contraband or I open fire!
Sector Security here, you're all clear. Safe travels.
Bastu! You flying leisure-class? My grandmother's faster!
I’m done with this rust bucket. Alighting at the next port!
Nice cargo... Think I’ll take it for myself!
Oh yeah, that one’s mine. Come to mama!
Mmm, that won’t do. (purrs) Be a dear and drop more...
Bit of help here! This one's got teeth!
Not this time. Let’s see you handle it alone.
I’m coming in hot! Bastu—you flap your lips more than you fire!
(laughter, throaty)
(laughter, throaty)
Bastu! You’re dumb, ugly, and about to be vapor!
(snarls) What is this? A death wish? 'Cause I’m granting it!
Well, well, look who drifted in. You lost, or just stupid?
Don’t get spaced out there, sweetheart.
Oops. Must’ve twitched the trigger. My bad—sorta.
Aaaaarghh! That’s gonna leave a mark!
You did good, pilot. Even I gotta admit that.
Swing your nose over toward the
You’ll find it yonder, off to the
Those scallywags? Last I saw, they were headin' for the
Me? I’m makin’ my way to the
North
South
East
West
Marking hostiles! Rolling in hot, weapons primed!
They're swarming from all vectors—need backup now!
Under fire! Shields can't take much more!
Taking hits! Shields flickering—brace for breach!
Hull integrity failing! This bird won't hold!
They’re on my six—can’t shake 'em! Need a wingman!
Core's redlining—she's gonna blow! Evac now!
One down! Mark that one for the scrap heap!
Burn, baby, burn! That’s what I’m talking about!
Boom! Direct hit—nothing left but vapor!
Now that’s a firework show! Scream louder next time, sweetheart.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
This is bad... We’re thinning out, but I can’t hold much longer!
It’s falling apart! Abort mission, I’m jumping out!
Missile lock! They’re firing—brace for impact!
Right on time.
Barely made it.
Listen up.
Got a job that screams your name—if you’ve got the guts.
Need a trigger-happy vet who’s been through real fire.
I want a ship—fast, quiet, and hard-hitting. Yours might do.
There’s a crate needs moving. Don’t ask what’s inside.
Got heat on my tail. Watch my six or watch me burn.
I need a freighter jockey who won’t ask questions or get caught.
Got a target that’s breathing too easy. Time to fix that.
Someone needs a lift, and they ain't fond of customs.
Need a seat on your ride. Discretion buys you extra credits.
Things are about to go sideways—get me outta here, now!
Need someone to slap together a base. Quiet-like, no permits.
Got wares that need to vanish across the sector. You in?
Need eyes on someone who’s gone dark. Think you can trace 'em?
Looking for a loyal gun hand—or at least a reliable one.
Might be something in it for you… if you’re not squeamish.
So, you game or not? I need someone with backbone.
You in, or are you wasting my time?
Wanna peek at the dirty details?
So, you givin’ me the go-ahead or not?
Feeding you the info—don’t choke on it.
Data’s comin’ in hot, brace yourself.
Here’s what you’ll need to pull this off.
This gig’s easy creds—shouldn’t even wrinkle your coat.
You might break a sweat, maybe more.
Things could get heavy—hope your hull holds.
Quick run, sharp turn. Don’t blink.
This one’s a slog, so stock up and strap in.
Expect company. The shooty kind.
Keep your scanners peeled—cops’ll sniff this out fast.
Stay low, stay fast, and don’t pick fights you can’t win.
Damn fine work. Would’ve gone sideways without ya.
You pulled it off clean. I’m impressed… ish.
Would’ve been scrap without you—credit where it’s due.
You? You’re climbin’ to the top of my list, mate.
Eh. That’ll do—for now. Next time, tighten it up.
Creds are movin'. Try not to blow it all in one bar.
That was pathetic. You’re a joke—beat it!
Pull the plug! Job's scrapped, and so are you.
Oi! Don’t go ghostin’ me yet—we ain’t finished!
Check your damn nav, pilot! You're flyin’ blind!
Clock’s bleeding out, mate—get yer thrusters movin’!
Time’s up, whelp. You missed the mark.
What in the void was that!? You’ve completely lost the plot!
Nah, this job’s for someone who’s got real teeth.
You’ll need a gunboat, not that tin can you’re flyin’.
Need a proper freighter for this gig. Yours ain’t cuttin’ it.
No jumpdrive? No job. That’s the deal.
Transporter’s non-negotiable on this run.
Come back when you’ve geared up proper, greenhorn.
Hatch’s sealed—I’m in. Let’s get rollin’.
Punch it, pilot. Time’s wastin’!
Yer grip on that thruster’s softer than space mold! Fly, damn you!
Let me off this tin can before I lose me lunch!
Not bad, pilot. Got me here in one piece!
What in void’s name—ain’t no way I’m squeezin’ into that crate!
You expect me to ride back there and *breathe vacuum*? Get a real transport system!
I’m no freighter freight! You want this run, get a proper ship or we’re done.
Cargo's in hand. Much obliged, scallywag!
This stash won’t last. Get movin’ with the next load!
I've seen Goners with more spine! Gear up proper next time!
We’re haulin' yer goods aboard now. Don’t scratch the paint!
You think this is fine!? Look at me! It ain't fine, you void-brained slag!
Lock in your intercept and blast every scumbag in range.
Fall back! We regroup at the base or we die tryin’!
Tearing through the lines—guns hot! Reinforcements just made the jump!
Sweet stars, more firepower pourin' in through the gate!
Ha! The frackin' cavalry shows up! 'Bout time, you slackers!
Brace yourselves! We've got enemy ships spillin’ through the gate!
Don’t get cocky—run to base for patch-ups if you’re leakin’!
Hold the line! Let ‘em come to us!
All ships, listen up! Orders incoming!
Pilot! You ain't done yet—here’s what you do next.
Stick to my thrusters, don’t fall behind!
Quit grinnin’ and button it up! We got trouble, inbound
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Set yer intercept, and close the gap—go, go, go!
Mines dead ahead! Evasive now, unless you like flyin’ in chunks!
Eyes up and guns hot. We’ll need cover fire real soon.
What are ya, brain-fried? Yer hold's stuffed! Dump some cargo or stay stuck!
Dock up here so I can sling you what you’re after.
Too many eyes out here. Get docked and we’ll hand off the goods quiet-like.
Now *that’s* a ship worth the trouble. Bring ‘er in and dock!
You draggin’ your thrusters for a reason? Get on with it!
Bring it in, slow and steady. Dock up now.
You’re outta range, genius. Ease forward a notch!
Close contact! Fall back! Fall back *now*!
No scraps left for you at the moment. Sit tight or go cause trouble elsewhere.
You’ve earned your salt with us. We got somethin’ shiny with your name on it.
Oi, Sector pigs on the horn! They say you’ve got a hotbody aboard. Cut ‘em loose or they’ll come knockin’—guns first!
If yer spine grows back, come crawling back later.
Say that again and I’ll teach you the hard way!
Relax, mate. Give it another go—you ain’t dead yet.
Now *that’s* what I’m talkin’ about! Nice work!
Hah! That’s slick flying right there!
Aye, you nailed it! That’s how we roll!
You tailin’ me for fun, or you lookin’ to get spaced?
That’s the cost, take it or sail off!
You’re with the Terran fleet? Bold of you to stroll into this part of space. But hey, I’ve worked with worse.
Name’s Mira Selis. I used to be a researcher for one of the corporate labs before I saw how much more freedom, and credits, there are in pirate space.
Now, I don't just give away my expertise for free. If you want my help, you're going to have to prove you're not another starched-uniform errand boy.
Let’s see if you can fly like one of us. I've arranged a simple smuggling run. Nothing too fancy—just slip a few cases of *unsanctioned tech components* past some overly curious customs patrols.
If you get pinched, I don’t know you. But if you pull it off clean, then maybe, just maybe, I’ll help you figure out what those wrecks of yours are hiding.
Well well... you pulled it off. Smooth work, flyboy. Maybe there's hope for you Terrans after all.
A deal's a deal. I've packed my research kit and said my goodbyes, such as they were. Get me to that Terran outpost in Saturn, and we’ll see what secrets your wrecks are hiding.
Aye, you’ve earned my respect, pilot. I’ll throw in with you, swing by and pick me up.
Unlocking these secrets is vital if we want to reconnect the lost colonies and help them rejoin the wider Terran community.
Huh. If someone went through the trouble of severing a gate, they had to be desperate... or smart. Maybe both.
We pirates call that “cutting the trail.” Lose the scent. Seems these pioneers were playing the same game on a galactic scale.
No weapons, no guards, no warnings. Either they cleared out fast... or they never came back to finish the job.

page.title: Argon/Terran Female - Polly - Us - Salli
page.t: I'd better be in your sights for a reason, pilot. Stand down!
You're close to finding yourself in a world of pain.
You think I travel alone or unguarded? Think again.
I'm done talking, pilot. Not done fighting though. Hell no!
I'm under fire! Under fire! Need fighter support!
I'll spread your ashes across the sectors!
Systems failing, you gotta give me a chance!
I'm breaking apart here! Stand down! Stand down!
Can't breathe! (strangled cries)Eaaahhh!
Understood!
If you're looking for a fight, keep pushing, pilot.
You're flying on borrowed time. Don't force me to give the order!
I'm weapons-free. Attack vector set.
State your business?
Do I look like I frickin' care? Bite me!
Not able to deal with you now, patch in to me another time.
That's not something I can help with.
Not my jurisdiction. Sorry!
You want me to what? You're kidding right? Am I on a CamShow?!
Say again. I was laughing so hard I missed that last part.
Those better not be scorch-marks on my hull!
Take her! Just get the hell off my six! I'm done fighting!
Cargo coming your way. Now break it off!
Force Commander online. What do you require?
Sweet-talk all you want, you'll be smouldering fire when I'm done.
No time. Leave your ID; if you're cute, I'll check in later.
You're going to have to figure that out on your own.
You would be wise to watch your mouth, my patience wears thin.
Set your waypoint for the
Look around you, you are already here!
Sorry pilot, i have no idea where that is.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Your reputation precedes you, we will direct you towards the
You honour me with your presence.
This is Sector Patrol, your cargo is hot! Drop the illegals now!
Arming weapons, comply or you will be fired upon!
Scans confirm you're clean and good to go. Thank you for your cooperation.
Don't care how long you keep me onboard, neeeeever gonna happen.
That's quite enough, I'm done flying with you.
Let me lighten your load a little. Drop your shields and let's party.
That's a start. Now show me a little more, sweetcheeks.
(cold)I don't want to have to hurt you.. so drop the wares, (hard)NOW!
Oh great! Now you decide to fight back! Calling for support!
Really don't think so. This one's all yours.
Setting intercept course. I'm on the way.
(laughter)
(laughter)
Is that your ship exhaust or your breath!?
You're nothing more than a weedhead.
(greeting)Good to see you, pilot!
(bye, spoken warmly,softly)See you on the other side...
Didn't mean that! Standing down.
Hraaaaaarh!
I have been blessed, thank you.
Over to
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Hostiles locked! Engaging targets!
My ship's taking a hammering.
I'm under attack! Can't shake 'em!
My shields won't hold out!
I'm taking hull damage!
They're on my six, can't shake them!!
Reactor's reaching critical, about to blow!
They're too many for me!
Now that's what I call a kill!
You ain't all that!
Reap the whirlwind. Reap it.
I'll bring you to your knees and make you beg for your life.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
(fleeing)You're too cute to kill and I'm too hot to die. Bugging out.
(fleeing)You're crazy! Frickin' crazy! I'm gone!
Got a mike on my six!
This missile's got a solid tone on me!
(prefix to 803 )Great timing!
(prefix to 803 )Ah! What fortunate timing.
(prefix to 803 )I'm so happy to speak to you.
I have a job that's perfect for you.
I need someone who knows how to handle a ship and weaponry.
I need a ship, tough and fast.
I'm looking for a courier to bring me some wares.
I need a wingman, strictly protection and cover.
Looking for someone who can handle a freighter.
I need someone taken care of, (pronounced capeesh)capisce?
I've got a passenger in need of a ride.
I need to hitch a ride with someone, reckon you could take me?
You have to get me out of here, fast! Please, I need a ride!
I've been looking for someone to build me a station. You got the gear?
I'm going to need you to ship some items.
I need a bio-lock on someone... I want a confirmed find.
Hey I'm looking for someone to work for me, think you could stick it?
Yes, I've got something you can do.
I'm in need of a little help here.
Would you be interested?
D'you want to take a run through the details?
Stop gawking! You want the job or not?
Sending through the data now.
Sending full details now.
Here's the itinerary. This is what we need.
You'll walk through this no problem.
There might be a few bumps on this one.
You're going to take some heat on this mission.
You'll be done before starfall.
You won't be done with this for a while, have patience.
You'll have enemies on the lookout for you during this mission.
Check your six for police during this mission.
Check your six for enemies during this mission.
Amazing! Wouldn't have closed this one out without you!
You make me proud, real proud! Great work!
Thanks for your help with this one!
Great! Your work is without fault, as usual.
I reckon that will have to do. Make a little more effort next time?
Dispatching your payment now.
What the hell was that? You failed. Get the hell out of my sight.
Aborting! This mission is over, moron!
Great! I have a damn coward on my hands! That's it! You BETTER run!
Take a look through your charts, pilot!
You're on the clock and it's running down fast!
Shoot, that's it. You're through, out of time.
Think that's funny!? That's coming straight out of your pay!
Nothing happening! I want someone with stones.
You need a fully-prepped combat ship for this.
You need a fully-prepped transporter for this.
You'll need a jumpdrive for this mission.
Without a transporter device, nothing happening.
Go grab yourself one!
(Passenger on board)Okay, I'm secure!
(Passenger on board)Punch it! Get me where I want to be!
We're losing precious time here! Get there already!
I'm through with this, let me off your ship.
We made it! Thanks for the ride!
There's no way I'm going to fit in your hold!
Do I look like Xenon? Get a cargo life support system!
What? You want me to fly with you in that? Get a passenger transport!
Your delivery is confirmed. Great work!
Still need more. Awaiting further shipments.
Your ship's a little empty. Grab some equipment.
Your goods are being transferred.
What happened here? You think this is in any way acceptable? Think again.
Set your intercept vector and neutralise all hostiles.
We need to regroup! Fall back and head for the Command Base!
Someone call for a little extra fire? Light 'em up, we'll put 'em out.
Great! We have more ships punching in through the (gate)
Really glad to have you with us!
Make like you've got a plan! Enemy ships inbound through the (gate)
Great job! Move to base and get your repairs.
Hold here. Await further orders.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Follow my lead!
Whole heap of pain coming our way, incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Mark intercept. Punch in now!
Mines in sector, watch your vector!
I'll need your protection. Watch my six.
Unload some wares, you're out of space.
I can't deliver your cargo until you're docked.
You won't get anything until you're docked. I'll deliver the data when I see you.
Amazing! You have the ship! Dock it at this station please!
Is there something you're waiting for? Get on with it!
Lay in an approach vector and dock your ship, pilot.
You're out too far, move in a little closer!
Push back! You're in too deep!
I'm out of leads, pilot. Nothing, nada, zilch! Now scram!
Your efforts have not gone unnoticed. Please accept this reward.
Sector Security here. An unregistered passenger has been detected on your ship. Release him or we'll take action.
Come back and see me if you have a rethink.
Stop that right now!
Try again. Really, it's not a problem.
Well done, that's it!
Outstanding!
Chikusho! Now that's how you do it!
I suggest you stop following me!
Displaying the prices now.
Commander, I’ve reviewed your request for Crystalline Matrix. You do understand this material falls under strategic resource classification, correct?
Priority or not, we have limited reserves. Every crystal is accounted for, and most are already allocated to Terran defense and research projects.
I’ve read the Pioneer reports… Hard to imagine descendants of Earth surviving cut off for centuries. Still, handing over a controlled resource set is not a decision I take lightly.
You sound like High Command’s idealist corps, Commander. Very well, I can authorise a shipment, restricted quantity only. Enough to power one gate core. You’ll sign and assume full responsibility.
I’ll have it transferred to your command vessel. And Commander… understand, this isn’t a gift. It’s a test of trust, from the USC, and from me personally.
Then I hope your mission proves worth the risk. Dismissed, Commander. And… may the stars guide you safely home.

page.title: Polly: British, Emma
page.t: Let's hope your aggression is just a misunderstanding, pilot.
The Boron are peaceful, but not defenseless. You still have a chance for peace.
Please go. We do not wish to end our lives in conflict.
Our weapons will now defend against your aggression.
Boron vessel under fire, request help! Anyone!
By the Queen's grace you shall die!
Menelaus save us! We harbor no hostility!
Boron almost gone. Peace! Peace!
(Gurgling)Waters failing!
With pleasure.
You fire upon us! We hope by mistake!
You have but one chance to retreat... or die.
You breach our peace, we breach your hull.
How may we assist you?
May your tentacles wither!
Our time is short and our waters low. Try again later.
I have no words for you, pilot.
This matter does not involve the Boron.
You clearly underestimate my abilities, pilot.
Your requests are quite unusual for the Boron.
We will not allow your actions to pass unpunished.
You have my ship. Leave me be.
I have no wish to fight. Here, take my cargo.
You have the Commander's attention. State your business.
You have such hatred within you. It is good that you die.
We are too busy to offer response.
We have little to say to you... less to offer.
There is no logic in your request. Your humour does not please us.
We ask that you turn to the
You are already where you wish to be.
Those waters are unknown to us.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Menelaus blesses your journey towards the
Menelaus be with you.
We see that you have illegal wares. These you must drop!
Please release your illegal cargo. Or we will fire upon your ship!
We detect no illegal goods aboard. Menelaus protect you in your travels.
Do you know where you are or that I am with you? Make haste!
Travel with you is pointless. I will leave at your next dock.
You have much of what I need... much of what I want!
Menelaus thanks you!
You taunt me! More! There is more I know!
This one cares not for the Queen! Help in my battle!
I choose not to engage. This one is yours!
I will assist. Let us share the spoils!
(laughter, - demonic)
(laughter, - demonic)
Plankton brains you have!
You are full of BoGas!
Salutations.
Menelaus go with you.
We beg forgiveness.
(exclamation of pain)
We give thanks.
Over to the
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
North
South
East
West
Engaging hostile ships!
I am being overwhelmed!
I am under attack! Evasion has failed!
We lose our shields, we lose everything!
My ship's hull is under attack!
Enemies are bound to my rear. I cannot shake them!
The reactor has reached critical mass, it will soon explode!
There are too many! I cannot count!
Death becomes another.
Rest deep in my waters!
The Queen sends her regards.
Yours screams will remain unheard.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
(fleeing)No more, I choose life!
(fleeing)I return to my waters!
Doom chases me! There is a missile!
I cannot break the missile's lock!
(prefix to 803 )Fantastic timing!
(prefix to 803 )Fortuitous!
(prefix to 803 )We’re glad you reached out to us.
(generic job)I have a task that is perfect for you.
(combat mission)Boron in need of fighter pilot.
(I need a ship)I need a ship, graced by Menelaus!
(I need some wares)I need someone to collect some cargo and bring it back to me.
I seek protection, my journey may be perilous.
I must have a freighter pilot.
I need someone gone, permanently.
I have a passenger who wishes for transport to another location.
I must have transport to another location.
I must get out of here, fast!
I require the services of a station-builder!
There are some items I need you to deliver.
I wish to locate someone, details will be provided.
I wish to employ someone.
I do indeed have another job for you.
Would you be kind enough to help me?.
Is there something here of interest to you?
Do you wish to see the details?
Would you like to have this job?
I shall send the information to you now.
I am sending the data you require now.
Please review what we need.
This mission should offer you no great challenge.
This may prove to involve a little skill on your part.
This will be anything but easy. Do not underestimate the challenge.
There will be little time involved in this mission's completion.
This mission demands both time and skill. Ensure you have both.
You must expect enemy ships en-route.
Please give police ships a wide berth on this mission.
Please give enemies a wide berth on this mission.
You have my thanks, I would not have succeeded without you.
You have done a truly excellent job.
I thank you for your help in this matter.
As always, you have proven to be more than capable. Thank you.
Good enough, but far from perfect. In future, try a little harder.
I am sending your reward now.
Your performance disgusts me. Leave! Now!
Aborting! Your mission is over. You have failed.
Such cowardice. Where do you run to? It matters not, I will find you eventually.
Please review your mission guidance.
You are running short on time.
There is no more time. That's it.
(offensive action against mission object or actor)I do not understand. Have you completely lost your mind?
I cannot accept you, you lack experience.
You must have access to a combat ship for this mission.
You must have access to a transport ship for this.
You must have a jumpdrive installed.
You will not succeed without a transporter device.
Do not waste my time, please obtain one!
I have placed myself securely onboard.
Let us depart.
I am not in the mood for a pleasure cruise! Fly faster!
Let me off, I require a pilot who actually knows how to fly.
You have delivered me safely. I thank you for your care.
I have no space in your ship! I must have more!
I cannot go with you without a cargo life support system.
I am not cargo! Get a passenger transport!
Shipment received!
Delivery not yet complete. Awaiting further shipments.
We will not go far unless you have equipment, pilot!
Now you receive the wares.
What happened here, pilot? Did you lose your mind?
Push to intercept and eliminate all hostile ships.
Our progress is slow! We must regroup at headquarters!
Reinforcements are here. Let's make them count.
By the Queen's grace, reinforcements arrive through the (gate)
Menelaus be praised! We are happy to see you!
Enemy ships approaching through the (gate)
You do well. Travel onwards to base for repairs.
You must remain here.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Follow and do as I do.
We've got incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Maximum speed, move to intercept!
Mines surround us, take care!
Protect my ship. Our safety is paramount.
There is no space in your hold. Empty your bays!
You will not have your cargo until you are docked.
We offer you no data until you dock!
Praise the Queen! The ship is here. Please dock at this station.
Is there a reason for the delay? Please complete your task!
We ask that you dock your ship.
Too far away! You must be closer, move forwards!
Be careful! You must not get too close!
Our books show little that would be of interest to you.
Menelaus praise you. We offer a token of appreciation for your work.
An illegal life-form has been detected on your ship. Boron request immediate release.
If you reconsider, we'll be waiting.
Please discontinue that!
There would be no shame in another attempt.
That's good, you have it!
Most excellent!
You have the knack, it seems!
We do not like to be followed.
We will display the prices for you.
Salutations hunter. I've identified a potential new sector, but unfortunately, I lack the means to reach it. I believe you possess a device capable of locating a hyperspace access point.

Fantastic. Initially, we must enhance the device by adding extra targeting parameters; otherwise, it won't effectively detect the location. Proceed to my engineering contact to obtain the upgrade, and be prepared to complete a task if necessary.

I've communicated with my guild contacts, and they're coordinating the delivery of a Trans-Orbital Accelerator to facilitate access to the new sector. They'll reach out to you shortly if additional assistance is required. Thank you for your commendable efforts, pilot; this contribution will significantly enhance the guild's influence.
Pilot, we've arrived. Please take me to the nearby trading station.
Appreciate it, hunter. You're free to head out and locate the Hyperspeed access point now.
Greetings fellow navigator, how can I assist?
Ah, you must be the Terran pilot I was informed about, welcome.
I’d be glad to help, but unfortunately, I’m in the middle of something at the moment.
I could use your assistance. The local sectors are in urgent need of food supplies. If you can deliver the much-needed provisions, I’ll be able to join you afterward.
The Xenon remnants we’ve found are dangerous. We must be cautious as we scan and investigate these wrecks.
Oh, delightful! A Terran, here to unravel mysteries!

You speak of old ships, forgotten designs... It tingles my curiosity like electric algae! I would be positively bubbling to assist, but I'm afraid science must wait for sustenance. I could use your assistance.

The local sectors are in urgent need of food supplies. If you can deliver the much-needed provisions, I’ll be able to join you afterward. Deliver the supplies, and I shall pack my equipment and swim straight into your investigation!
Oooh! Gululu remembers now! The old gate harmonics sing. This one, this one is... off-key. Closed like a clam in deep waters.
Not just damaged, cut off. Someone closed the loop. That means someone wanted to hide.
Fascinating, yes! A gate hidden from even ancient Terran records? This indicates deliberate rerouting or suppression of its signal signature. Not natural, no no!
If the Pioneer Terrans tampered with gate architecture, it suggests they understood far more about jump network geometry than previously believed. Or… perhaps someone else did?

Yes yes! Althes does not follow the usual gravitic footprints of standard gate-lane structures. Something reconfigured this system, intentionally. The Pioneers may have been more clever than we assumed. Or... something else wanted them hidden.
And look, look! Residual field harmonics... still pulsing! There may be trace nav data locked in the sub-layer. We must scan it!
A new ecosystem... untouched by modern interference! Ooh, the data we could collect…!
Some of these facilities are still drawing power, faint but present. Automated systems, perhaps? Maintenance drones long gone feral...?

page.title: Polly: NZ, Aria
page.t: Why pick on me?
Boron orders to return fire!
You have pushed Boron patience too far, help is on its way!
Now Boron show how to fight!
Praise Queen Atreus - Boron transporter needs help!
For the love of the Queen!
No more please. I want peace!
No freight is worth the loss of life!
AAAAARGH!
OK.
Boron captain hopes you did not mean to do that!
Boron Captain demands you stop firing instantly.
Boron captain now forced to blow you to space debris!
Boron has pleasure in asking how we can help?
For peace sake!
Boron have much better things to do then help you find way!
Information you ask is Kingdom classified!
Boron not responsible for that.
Boron asks for repeat of question - cannot understand we are at peace!
Boron does not yield freight easily!
Boron say it not that easy!
Boron not want violence again - I leave ship!
Boron not want violence again - I drop freight!
Boron Captain willing to listen to your incoming communication. What do you require?
Do not dare to ask Boron captain for information!
Boron is busy at the moment!
You are enemy of the Boron and the captain does not communicate with such!
Boron do not appreciate your humour. Now go before we take offence!
Boron knows it is behind the
Boron knows you are already there.
Boron knows not of location, apologies.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
The Boron race welcomes contact with such as you. The area you seek is behind the
Boron very glad to be of help! Good bye.
Our services cost
credits for every gate we go through.
This is the captain, We are fully occupied.
Pointless talk - you cannot afford our services!
Captain speaking - We follow you and charge every gate we cross!
Captain speaking. I am very much afraid we have no space here. May I suggest we move somewhere else.
Captain speaking. Everything is fine. We will commence unloading freight now.
It has been a pleasure working for you.
Boron Kingdom Police to pilot - we suspect you are carrying illegal goods - stop and drop your illegal freight or we fire!
Pilot - when Boron Police say drop illegal freight we meant NOW - otherwise we fire!
We scanned your ship and did not find any illegal goods aboard. Thanks for your cooperation.
Boron in rush, needs to get to station quickly!
Boron demand that you let me out at the next station!
We don't like killing - so you are advised to give up freight!
Your freight is better than your death!
You have more freight - I know!
Please - urgent assistance required!
We would like to help but can't!
We don't like fight - but pirates must stick together!
Indeed, I can enhance your device, but regrettably, I cannot do it at this moment. More pressing matters demand my immediate attention.
Feel free to give it a shot. Should you assist me, I'll reciprocate by upgrading your device.

Though it pains me to confess, I was once affiliated with a pirate clan. I've been striving to sever ties with them, but departing from such groups isn't a straightforward process. The clan is persistent, sending hunters to eliminate me. If you can dispatch these pursuers, it would convey a clear message to the clan to cease their pursuit, allowing me to resume my endeavors.
Commencing the upgrade now. Please stay docked during the process. I'll reach out to you once it's complete, it shouldn't take too long.

page.t: Your shooting offends me!
Boron are not afraid of giving fight!
I regret to inform you that Boron fighter support is on its way!
For the Kingdom.........!
By The Queen! - Where is my fighter support?
For the love of the Queen!
Please stop to think about what you are doing!
Shields going down! - Boron transporter needs urgent help.
AAAAARGH!
Affirmative.
For the sake of Queen Atreus - do not force us to take evasive action!
Boron Captain.
It will be hard lesson Boron Captain must teach you!
Boron ask ... what??
Boron does not help someone like you!
Greetings from Queen Atreus. We are sorry but we are too busy!
Boron have much better things to do then help you find way!
Sorry, I'm not responsible for that.
Boron asks for repeat of question - cannot understand we are in peace!
Boron cannot drop Kingdom freight just at your demand?
Never! Boron rather die!
Please no more shooting - The Boron yield!
Boron met before - Boron yield freight!
This is Boron Captain. How may we be of assistance?
Rolk's pity - You dare attempt to communicate? Go quickly!
Boron captain cannot stop action to talk?
You are enemy of the Boron and the captain does not communicate with such!
We are puzzled. Are we meant to take your threat with seriousness!
We advise you to fly behind the
Boron knows you are already there.
Boron knows not of that location!
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
All the Kingdom is in praise of such a pilot. We advise you to fly behind the

credits for every gate we go through.
This is the captain, We are fully occupied.
Pointless talk - you cannot afford our services!
Captain speaking - We follow you and charge for every gate we cross!
Captain speaking. I am very much afraid we have no space here. May I suggest we move somewhere else.
Captain speaking. Everything is fine. We will commence unloading freight now.
It has been a pleasure working for you.
Boron Kingdom Police to pilot - we suspect you are carrying illegal goods - stop and drop your illegal freight or we fire!
Drop illegal freight NOW - otherwise we fire!
We scanned your ship and did not find any illegal goods onboard. Thank you for your cooperation.
Boron in rush, needs to get to station quickly!
Boron demand that you let me out at the next station!
Boron not kill unless you give freight!
Boron take freight!
Boron want all freight!
Please - help needed or I will have to give up freight!

Boron get there soon!

Certainly, esteemed pilot. As part of the necessary procedures, we kindly request a nominal administration fee totaling 10,000 credits to facilitate the seamless processing of your requirements. Your prompt attention to this matter is greatly appreciated.
Great! Prior to accepting your membership, we have a task for you.

Critical guild affairs demand our attention, and we require your assistance in transporting one of our dignitaries as they conduct their business. Fulfill this task, and we will gladly welcome you into the Celestial Navigators.

Split need pilot for work! You have skill! Request you contact us!

Which bounty do you wish to claim for?
Greetings Mercenary, we need an administration fee of 15'000 credits from you.
Excellent. Before we finalize your membership, we have an assignment for you. We've been tasked with escorting a freighter and need you to protect it.
Hey there merc, are can the guild help?
Well done merc, you are now a member of our great guild
Mercenary, please return to the Citadel of Valor
You must be the assassin i've been waiting for

A simple task, indeed. We require you to build a factory here, but not just any factory, it must be one from those irritating Boron. As enemies, we cannot simply purchase it ourselves. This is where you come in.

page.title: Paranid: Polly, US: Joey
page.t: You would be wise to hold your fire, lowerlife.
Your charge upon us is pitiful. A final warning do we give.
What is ours is not yours. Think carefully lowerlife.
May our fire cleanse you in death!
Calling for righteous defence of our holy ship.
Filthy, unclean beast! Be gone!
Surrounded by your stench do we beg for mercy.
Paranid ship fouled by unholy aggression. Shields failing!
Unholy fire! Aaaahhhhh!
We honour your word.
You dare fire upon the Paranid? Pitiful wretch!
Our weapons have you marked. Choose your fate, pilot.
Reap the storm of our holy fire, pilot.
What do you wish to speak of?
You defile our peace, wretched one!
We have much to deal with, leave us!
Your words are worthless.
We are above such matters.
(Laughs)The two-eyes are so full of humour.
Pitiful wretch, how dare you!
Your pitiful life will soon come to an end.
Take it! You pitiful creature!
Take my cargo! I curse your wretched ways!
Bridge Commander speaking. Our time is not yours to waste. Speak quickly!
Our words are of no use to your miserable soul.
There is no time for your foolish words. Be gone!
Your questions shall go unanswered, (mutters)pitiful wretch...
I will take your request under advisement and THEN kill you!
You would be wise to journey to the
You are one dimension short of a paradox. You are already where you wished to travel to.
The path is shrouded in darkness. We know not of it.
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
To bring light to your path, travel onwards to the
May your path shine brightly.
Pitiful wretch, did you think you could escape our scans? Drop your cargo. Now!
You would be wise to comply, our weapons are not so forgiving.
Let us not keep you. Your vessel is pure. Journey onwards.
Is there any hope for your kind? From this journey, I think not. Make haste!
Enough! Dock so I may find a pilot who holds skill greater than a drunken Argnu.
Allow me to lighten your load a little. You have much that I need.
There is hope for you yet. Your cargo is gratefully accepted.
You would surely offer us more if you knew of your impending death.
It seems I will not survive this battle alone, come to me!
Show honour not fear, the battle is yours alone. Prevail or die.
I will take your side. We will prevail.
(laughter)
(laughter)
I spit my every breath at you!
Your soul has neither hope, nor light.
(greeting)By the three!
Light be with you.
I offer my humble apology.
(pain)
You honour me with your help.
Over to the
It's over to the
They're over to the
I'm over to the
north.
south.
east.
west.
Hostile forces abound! Engaging!
My ship suffers greatly under this mortal fire.
I have come under attack!
My shields hold little strength. Soon they will fall.
I am taking hull damage, soon too much to bear.
I fear this one is bound too close, I cannot evade.
The reactor will soon reach critical mass, and explode.
There are too many, we must not count, we must fight!
Darkness fills this one.
May it burn in the fires for eternity!
I cast unto you my wrath!
Walk into the light, fear not the fire, it burns but briefly.
(rage/screaming while shooting)
(freak out/under heavy attack)
My time here is over. Fare thee well!
I would be wise to reconsider such an untimely martyrdom.
I detect an unholy projectile!
Curses! A missile is locked onto my ship!
(prefix to 803 )Your timing honours you.
(prefix to 803 )Just in time, excellent.
(prefix to 803 )I am honoured that you called.
I have something to which your skills could be applied.
I am in need of a combat pilot.
I need a ship untainted by one such as you!
I require the delivery of various items.
I have no wish to die in this wretched place, my journey requires protection.
I must have a freight pilot
I seek someone skilled in the art of assassination.
I have a passenger, one who requires transport.
I need transportation, the ship must be worthy of my status.
I must bring my time here to an end, quickly!
I shall have the services of a station-builder, perhaps you!
I seek a courier worthy of dealing with a shipment requiring collection and return.
I wish to trace the location of a certain individual.
I require someone of both courage and honour to work for me.
Yes, there is another job to which you would be suited.
You will assist me.
Does this interest you?
Do you think the job worthy of seeing further details?
Do you think yourself capable of taking the job?
The information needed is being transmitted to you now.
I shall send the details to you now.
This is what we require.
Given your skills, this mission will offer no great challenge to you.
You will find challenges during this mission, none insurmountable.
Given your skills, this mission may prove to hold great difficulty.
Given your skills, this mission should not take long.
This job is far from short in duration.
There will be hostile forces present during your journey.
Be wary of police on this mission.
Be aware of enemies on this mission.
This would not have been possible without you. I thank you.
You have done well, an excellent job if I may say so.
Your help has been appreciated.
I thank you. Your work remains exemplary.
Acceptable, perhaps. I expected more from you; try harder next time.
Your reward will be with you shortly!
I have rarely seen such a display of ineptitude! Get out of my sight!
Miserable wretch, you have failed! Mission over!
Run, coward, run! No sector is safe, I will find you, I WILL find you!
Check your guidance systems.
You have very little time, make haste!
Your time has come to an end.
By the light, you test me! I curse your soul for this!
Experience in navigation is essential, you have no such experience.
A combat ship is essential for this.
You will require a ship capable of transport for this.
A jumpdrive is required.
You'll need a transporter device.
Get one now!
I am onboard. All is secure.
Let us begin our journey.
I have seen Maja snails move faster. Make haste.
You bring me closer to death than my destination. I wish to leave this wretched ship.
I must depart, our journey has come to an end.
Unholy one, you must provide me with more space.
You will require a life support system to take passengers onboard!
You dare offer me passage in that? I must have a passenger transport!
Your delivery has been processed.
Deliveries are incomplete. We await completion.
No ship will last long without suitable equipment. Buy some.
Now transferring the wares.
There is no sense to this. What happened here pilot?
Engage intercept course at full thrust. Eliminate all hostile ships.
We would be wise to regroup and fall back to base for now.
Support is here! Let us burn these unholy wretches!
We have much to be thankful for, reinforcements join us from the (gate)
We are delighted that you join us.
We detect enemy ships incoming through the (gate)
You show promise. Move to base for repairs.
We will hold here, no more, no less.
All ships! (Followed by command or information)
Pilot! (Followed by command or information)
Remain close to me. Follow my lead!
We've got incoming (933-936)
missiles.
fighters.
bombers.
ships.
Set course to intercept. Thrusters at maximum!
Those mines will not take kindly to contact. Show caution.
There must be no attack against our ship!
You would be wise to empty your hold, your cargo needs more space.
Your cargo will not be transferred until you dock at our station.
The data you require will remain with us until you dock.
Please dock the ship at the station immediately.
What is keeping you? Get going!
Your ship would do well to dock.
Your distance concerns us. Move closer.
You are far too close! Move away!
You would be wise to seek work elsewhere. We have nothing of interest to you.
Our faith in the unholy one is restored. Your loyal service will not go unrewarded.
Paranid Security detect illegal passenger. Unholy one will release it or die.
Return later if you desire, the offer may still stand.
Don't repeat that action!
Trying again brings no shame.
Good! You appear to have it!
You impress the Paranid!
That's the way it should be done!
Are you following us, unholy one?
I will display for you the prices.
I need someone to help construct a station here. If you can source and build a Space Jewellery M, I would be grateful.
Thanks for the help pilot, this should be very useful for us.
Welcome back, pilot. Since you’ve helped us before, we need your assistance once more.
We've discovered a new group of sectors we want to expand into, but the gate leading there is damaged. We need to figure out how to repair it.
The Terrans are known for building and repairing gates. We need you to acquire that knowledge from them—but we doubt they’ll share it willingly.
Exactly. We have another agent stationed near the Terran border who has more details. Go meet with them.
Assassin, how can the Guild help?
Ah there you are loyal assassin. We are looking to build a proper headquarters for the guild and we need your assistance.

We have discovered an unclaimed sector we wish to utilize. We need your help to claim it for the guild. First, head to the new sector and rendezvous with your contact there, who will provide further instructions.
This is Paranid sector security, stop your engine and prepare to be scanned.
We've had a lot of Yaki smugglers around here recently, we need to scan everyone.
Cargo shielding detected, surrender your ships.
You have come to the right place. As a Paranid, my scientific knowledge is unmatched. However, my brethren are currently in need of my aid. If you can offer your support, I shall accompany you.
Our convoys have been under constant attack from troublesome Yaki raiders. We need help in dealing with them.
You honor the Three-Eyed, pilot. I will aid you, come and collect me.
The actions of the Terran Pioneers resonate deeply within our culture. Their decision to sever the gate reflects a profound commitment to protection.
We stand ready to assist you in this vital endeavor to reconnect the lost colonies.

Terran High Command seeks wisdom beyond its vision? How refreshingly honest. Your kind, ever eager to master that which they barely comprehend, now turn to those gifted with the clarity of three eyes. Ancient gates, you say? Hmph. Many whisper of relics, but few recognize their deeper truths. If these remnants are indeed as you describe, then they demand interpretation only the Paranid can provide, not your blinkered engineers.

You seek clarity? Then gaze through eyes not burdened by ignorance. I will accompany your investigation, not for your sake, Terran, but because truth yearns to be revealed. Perhaps, in your blundering, you have uncovered something worthy of true study.

However, there is a matter of mutual benefit. Our convoys have been under constant attack from troublesome Yaki raiders. We need help in dealing with them. Assist us in protecting our sacred commerce, and I shall lend you my insights.
Terran records are as scattered as your gate networks. Perhaps if your ancestors had three eyes, you’d have seen this coming.
Still... the signal echo does carry faint traces of gate harmonics. Damaged, fragmented, yet... deliberate. I dare say, someone shut a gate on purpose.
Signs of industrial-scale resource extraction. They harvested this system for something. But this is only part of the puzzle.

page.title: Teladi Variation new 1 (Polly: Welsh-Geraint)
page.t: Why you pick on me!
Teladi would like to know what you think you are playing at!
You have pushed toleration too far, I call for help.!
Teladi not looking to start a war - but we will fight back!
I have trouble. Help needed quickly!
You have no sense - you lose profit!
Please. Teladi request!
Deep trouble out here - profit is going to be lost!
AAAAARGH!
Affirmative.
Teladi command assumes that was an accident!
This is the Teladi's final warning.
Now you feel full Teladi anger!
Teladi asks what can I do for you?
Teladi don't want contact with you!
Teladi ask you try again when I'm less busy!
Teladi prefer to make profit then help you find way!
Teladi is not responsible for that.
Teladi say profit before surrender!
Teladi suggest that you might be making joke?
Teladi do not give up profit easily!
Teladi ask you no shoot! We give up! Take ship!
Teladi ask you no shoot! We give up freight!
I am a Teladi captain. What is it you require?
Hiisssssss.........! Teladi do not want to speak to you!
Teladi Captain currently occupied!
We don't want to talk to you!
Never has the Teladi Company Space Fleet been so insulted. Now go while you still live. !
Teladi know trading area. It is somewhere behind the
Teladi know trading area. You are already there!
Teladi don't know that sector!
North gate.
South gate.
West gate.
East gate.
Teladian greetings! Your fame speeds before you. We are happy to tell you to search beyond the
Teladi Captain happy we could help! Good profitsss.
We welcome chance to make profit with you. Our service will cost you only
Credits for every gate we go through.
It grieves us to say we are busy transporting freight for another customer. Please try contacting us again, and we will offer a good price!
We notice that you cannot afford our services - make profit to accumulate more!!
We will be hired by you. We'll follow you and make profit in every gate we cross!
We cannot make profit unloading where there is no space. Move where there is room to unload.
It is good to unload freight here.
It was a pleasure making profit with you. May profit go with you.
This is Teladi Company Police Security Force. Pilot we ask to stop immediately! - Illegal goods are aboard your ship. Drop cargo or we fire!
Teladi Company Police Security Force to Pilot - we said drop goods - do it now or we fire!
This is Teladi Company Police Security Force. We scanned your ship and did not find any illegal goods aboard. Thanks for your cooperation.
Pilot, did you forget me? I have to get to my destination quickly before I lose profit!
I have lost my profit, I demand that you let me out at the next station!
We tough - you lose - give freight!
We your freight have!
We, all your freight ask give!
Fellow pirates - help my ship needs!
We too far way. Fight tougher!
We come. Fight together!
I offer my thanks for your assistance.
Shipment confirmed.
Awaiting further shipments to complete order.
Very well trader. We require an administration fee of 50,000 credits.
Excellent! Before we can accept your membership into our guild, we have a task for you to complete.
One of our esteemed clients requires supplies urgently. Can you procure the necessary wares and deliver them to the designated factories? You'll be responsible for sourcing the wares independently.
What are your desires from the Merchants Guild?
Your failure to deliver on time has resulted in the revocation of your membership.
Why did you terminate the delivery? The mission has concluded, and your membership has been rescinded.
Thank you pilot, please return to the Emporium Nexus, to finalise your membership.
Congratulations, trader, you are now an esteemed member of our Guild.

Guilds are expansive organizations governing themselves on a galactic scale. Members within a guild enjoy access to various benefits, encompassing employment opportunities, assignments, equipment, and even ships and stations. Typically, guilds establish headquarters where prospective members can apply for membership. Additionally, many trading stations feature a guild board, a platform where guilds post tasks and jobs available for members to undertake.

Bounty Hunters Headquarters

In the far reaches of the cosmos, where lawlessness and danger often eclipsed the reach of official authorities, the Bounty Hunters Guild emerged as a beacon of order and retribution. This covert guild, was founded to fill the void left by ineffectual law enforcement agencies and to bring swift justice to the interstellar frontier.
Tracked Bounties
Last Seen
Bounty Details
Track Bounty
Remove Tracking
Name
Send to Log

The origins of the Bounty Hunters Guild date back to a time when space colonies and trading hubs teetered on the brink of chaos. Lawlessness ran rampant, and piracy became an ever-present threat to the burgeoning spacefaring civilizations. A group of experienced and determined individuals from diverse backgrounds saw an opportunity to establish a force that could stand against the tide of criminality.

Under the leadership of an enigmatic Paranid known simply as “Starfall,” the guild adopted a code of ethics that emphasized the capture of notorious criminals, the retrieval of stolen goods, and the protection of innocent lives. They developed an extensive network of informants, sophisticated tracking technology, and a fleet of well-equipped starships, all tailored for the dangerous work of hunting bounties across the galaxy.

The guild’s membership quickly grew to encompass a broad spectrum of individuals, from cyber-enhanced ex-soldiers to skilled trackers and technologically savvy hackers. Each Hunter underwent rigorous training in combat, investigation, and diplomacy, ensuring that they were well-prepared for the complex, ever-evolving challenges of their profession.

Bounties offered by the Bounty Hunters Guild ranged from capturing infamous space pirates and fugitive war criminals to retrieving stolen relics and lost starships. Successful completion of contracts was rewarded not only with substantial credits but also with respect and admiration from the communities they protected.

As the Bounty Hunters Guild flourished, it became a symbol of hope and justice on the fringes of the known universe. The Hunters’ stories of daring chases, epic showdowns, and relentless pursuit became legendary tales in the galaxy, celebrated for their unwavering commitment to preserving peace among the stars.

The Bounty Hunters Guild served as a vital force against lawlessness in the cosmos, a testament to the enduring power of unity and shared purpose among those who dedicated themselves to the noble cause of upholding justice on the stellar frontier.
Starfall \(Paranid\)

{player.name}, I've received communication from my contact, and it appears your upgrade was a success. Kindly return to my location and pick me up. Ensure your ship is equipped with cargo life support for my safe transport.

A brilliant tech inventor has disappeared, leaving behind a trail of sabotage and stolen prototypes. Your mission is to locate the inventor and return them here.
A notorious space pirate is wreaking havoc on trade routes. Your task is to locate and apprehend the outlaw.
Find and rescue the stranded pilot, and return them to safety.
A lone pilot's distress signal has been received from the far reaches of space. Rescue them and bring them back safely, all while dealing with potential external threats.
A pilot conducting an extravehicular activity \(EVA\) has become detached from their spacecraft. Your mission is to retrieve the stranded pilot.
On behalf of the ::GOV:: we request your assistance in bringing the outlaw \033G::PILOT::\033X of the \033G::RACE::\033X to justice.
The ::GOV:: are fed up with the constant attacks by \033G::PILOT::\033X of the \033G::RACE::\033X on our military transports.

The \033G::RACE::\033X pilot \033G::PILOT::\033X has been harassing various ::GOV:: traders. We have lost millions of credits due to their actions, this must stop. We request that you terminate ::PILOT:: immediately.
The ::GOV:: has had enough of the \033G::RACE::\033X and their arrogant ways. It's time to teach them a lesson by taking out one of their most famous pilots, \033G::PILOT::\033X
\033G::PILOT::\033X has stolen one of our ships. We pursued but ::PILOT:: activated his jump drive and managed to escape. The ::GOV:: wants this \033G::RACE::\033X dealt with as soon as possible
\033G::PILOT::\033X has stolen highly classified vital intelligence about the ::GOV::. We cannot allow the ::RACE:: to get their hands on this intelligence.
\033G::PILOT::\033X has been openly trading illegal wares around the ::GOV:: systems, this has to stop.
The ::GOV:: believe that \033G::PILOT::\033X of the \033G::RACE::\033X is conspiring to bring down the government.
\033G::PILOT::\033X is a traitor to the ::GOV::. ::PILOT:: has stolen the blueprints for an experimental M6 craft and needs to be eliminated before he can sell them to the highest bidder.
The traitorous scum ::PILOT:: has stolen a large sum of money from our headquarters in ::SECTOR::.

All pilots are hereby warned to be on the lookout for the notorious criminal ::PILOT::, who has cunningly escaped the custody of the ::GOV:: authorities. Intelligence reports indicate that ::PILOT:: is well armed and willing to kill for his freedom; pilots are warned to keep their distance unless equally well-protected.

I come to you with all the credits I have saved since the death of my firstborn. My name is ::AUTHOR:: of the ::GOV::. Thirty Jazura's ago, a ::GOV:: pirate landed on this station amidst the celebrations at the birth of our little princess. Under our very noses he stole her away to be sold for means we have never yet made clear. Despite many searches, our hopes slowly faded as first the mazuras, then jazuras went by. We know now that she will never come back to us. Our hearts still hold vengeance and injustice against this pirate who must be dealt with.\n\nWe see you to be of good character and spirit, all we ask is that you have a fast ship and good weaponry.

Since we believe the target has been assisted by spies within the government we must keep our actions secret. This means that you will be considered a hostile target by the local forces once you engage the target. If you succeed you will be rewarded well.

This is a highly classified mission. We cannot let the public know of this craft's existence therefore you will be treated as an enemy the by local forces. However, you will be highly rewarded if you are successful.
This is a covert operation, beware of the local forces who may turn against you. We will deny all knowledge your actions if you are caught.
The target was last seen in \033R::SECTOR::\033X flying a \033R::SHIP::-::SHIPCODE::\033X
We've been informed that ::PILOT:: was spotted in \033R::SECTOR::\033X, ::PILOT:: was last seen flying a \033R::SHIP::-::SHIPCODE::\033X.
The ::GOV:: report that ::PILOT:: was last seen in ::SECTOR:: and may attempt to flee for asylum.
Spies employed by this station have tracked down the ::RACE:: mercenary to ::SECTOR::.
You will receive payment if you kill and/or capture ::PILOT::. We will pay \033Y::PAY::\033X credits. If you capture ::PILOT::, return them to the Guild Headquarters.
::PILOT:: Wanted Dead or Alive, and you will be rewarded with ::PAY:: credits.
I will happily pay you the sum of ::PAY:: credits if you travel there immediately and show him that we have never forgotten, nor forgiven.
::PILOT:: must die for their actions. Ensure that the ship and ::PILOT:: are completely destroyed and we'll make sure you receive the payment of \033Y::PAY::\033X credits.
We offer a reward of ::PAY:: cr to anyone who brings about his undeniable destruction.
The ::GOV:: government is offering ::PAY:: cr for conclusive proof of the criminal's demise.
We have unfinished business with the bounty ::PILOT::. Please ensure ::PILOT::'s survival in order to receive the payment of \033Y::PAY::\033X credits. Return them to the Guild Headquarters.

Celestial Navigators Headquarters

In the vast expanse of space, where galaxies, star systems, and celestial wonders beckoned to be explored, the need for a reliable, interconnected transportation network became paramount. Amidst the cosmic tapestry, the Celestial Navigators Guild was born, a beacon of order and efficiency in the ever-expanding frontiers of the universe.

The guild’s genesis lay in the visionary mind of Boron Captain Halilo Bo, a seasoned starship pilot with a burning desire to unite the far-flung corners of the galaxy. Her dream was to create a transportation network that would enable seamless travel and trade between distant worlds, making the cosmos more accessible to all. Captain Halilo Bo believed that, with the right guidance and navigation expertise, the vastness of space could be harnessed to benefit civilizations across the universe.

The Celestial Navigators Guild emerged as a collective of pioneering spacefarers, scientists, and engineers, united by their shared vision of establishing a safe and interconnected transportation network spanning the cosmos. Guided by their belief that reliable and efficient space travel was essential for the growth and unity of spacefaring civilizations, they dedicated themselves to this noble cause.

As the universe continued to expand and evolve, the Celestial Navigators Guild’s legacy remained firmly rooted in their commitment to enabling seamless, efficient, and peaceful transportation across the cosmos. They were the celestial wayfinders, guiding civilizations to new horizons and connecting the stars themselves.
Halilo Bo \(Boron\)
Mula Wi \(\033BGuild Administrator\033X\)

Merchants Guild Headquarters

In the vast expanse of the cosmos, where civilizations and species interconnected through trade, known simply as “The Merchants Guild,” emerged as a pivotal force in the interstellar marketplace. The guild’s origins can be traced back to a time when disparate worlds, planetary colonies, and remote outposts sought a reliable framework for interstellar commerce.

The Merchants Guild was founded by a profit hungry Teladi, Wegoras Towisaris Dasinos I, who recognized the potential of unifying the fractured markets of the galaxy. Drawing upon her own experiences as a trader, Wegoras Towisaris Dasinos I rallied a diverse group of traders, economists, and diplomats to establish the guild’s foundational principles.

Under the astute leadership of Wegoras Towisaris Dasinos I, the Merchants Guild developed a comprehensive interstellar trade network that spanned star systems, planets, and asteroid belts. They implemented standardized trade agreements, established trade routes and infrastructure, and created a common currency, which facilitated commerce throughout the galaxy.

The guild attracted a multitude of members who hailed from various species and backgrounds, from shrewd negotiators to master pilots, and ingenious engineers. Each member was required to adhere to a strict code of ethics that emphasized fairness, transparency, and honesty in all trade dealings. This code earned them a reputation for integrity and trustworthiness, which was critical in the often treacherous world of interstellar commerce.

The Merchants Guild provided various services, including trade mediation, protection against piracy, and investment in promising planetary colonies. They ensured the safe transport of goods, technological innovations, and cultural exchanges, making them integral to the galactic economy. Their emblem, a celestial globe encircled by interconnected stars, became a symbol of prosperity and unity across the cosmos.

Over time, the Merchants Guild extended its influence, negotiating trade agreements between powerful factions, assisting in the distribution of vital resources, and contributing to the peaceful coexistence of various species and civilizations. Their commitment to fostering economic harmony became their enduring legacy.
\“The Merchants Guild” was celebrated not just as merchants but as peacemakers and custodians of the galaxy’s economic balance. Their story was a testament to the unifying power of commerce and the idea that, amidst the infinite expanse of the cosmos, the pursuit of mutual prosperity could serve as the foundation for unity and collaboration among the stars.
Wegoras Towisaris Dasinos I \(Teladi\)

The Mercenaries Guild.
I have paid my administration fee.
I'm looking to become a Mercenary
Mercenaries Guild Reward

Congratulations merc,

You have gained official membership in our guild. You can now access any available mercenary jobs.

Best of luck pilot.
Return to the Citadel of Valor to complete your application into the guild.

The Mercenaries Guild had their origins in the aftermath of a brutal interstellar conflict that had devastated entire systems, known as the Boron Campaign. Many of the veterans who had once served their respective factions found themselves disillusioned with the relentless cycle of war. They yearned for freedom, self-determination, and the opportunity to put their combat expertise to profitable use.

Under the visionary leadership of Split General Ghorok t’Zhht, a charismatic and battle-scarred commander, the Mercenaries Guild was founded. This guild quickly gained a reputation for their unwavering loyalty to their contracts, efficient execution of missions, and an unwavering commitment to maintaining their code of honor.

The guild’s diverse membership encompassed warriors from all corners of the galaxy, each with their own unique set of skills and combat styles. From cyber-enhanced soldiers to elite snipers, and starship aces to infiltration specialists, the Mercenaries Guild offered a versatile force ready to undertake a wide range of missions, from defensive operations and combat training to clandestine espionage and planetary invasions.

Contracts for the Mercenaries Guild varied widely, from providing security to trade convoys and defense to beleaguered colonies to toppling oppressive regimes and eradicating dangerous criminal organizations. The guild’s reputation for delivering results made them a sought-after force in the galaxy, attracting a broad clientele of planetary governments, megacorporations, and even private individuals.

General Ghorok t’Zhht instilled a strong sense of honor among the mercenaries, which included a strict rule against harming civilians, protecting their clients’ interests, and upholding the guild’s legacy of reliability. The Mercenaries Guild were notorious for never backing down from a fight, even in the face of overwhelming odds, and their iconic emblem, a pair of crossed celestial swords, became a symbol of hope and strength throughout the galaxy.

The Mercenary Guild’s story was one of camaraderie, adventure, and the pursuit of independence. They stood as a powerful testament to the indomitable spirit of those who chose to forge their destiny amidst the chaos and uncertainty of the stars.
General Ghorok t’Zhht \(Strong Arms\)

In the turbulent and lawless depths of the galaxy, the Mercenary Guild emerged as a formidable force, forged from a coalition of battle-hardened warriors, combat specialists, and renegade soldiers who sought independence and adventure beyond the constraints of conventional military structures.

In the shadowy depths of the intergalactic underworld, a clandestine organization known as the Assassins Guild arose, becoming the stuff of whispered legends and chilling tales among the stars. They were the Silent Shadows of the Stars, feared and revered for their unparalleled skills in the art of assassination.
Assassins Guild Payment: %s
SquidKiller \(Split\)

The origins of the Assassins Guild remain shrouded in mystery, their formation obscured by a tapestry of lies, disinformation, and untraceable trails. It is said that the guild was born out of a coalition of elite mercenaries, ex-military operatives, and brilliant scientists, each with their own reasons for delving into the darkest realms of contract killing.

Under the fearless leadership of a figure known only as “SquidKiller”, presumed to be a Split pirate from a long dead Split Family, the Assassins Guild meticulously honed their craft. They embraced cutting-edge technology, biologically enhanced agents, and specialized weaponry to become the most formidable assassins in the galaxy. Each member was trained to be a master of disguise, infiltration, and the art of silent takedowns.

Contracts for the Assassins Guild ranged from eliminating political dissidents and corporate rivals to sabotaging interstellar negotiations and erasing individuals who possessed knowledge too dangerous to be shared. With their reputation for efficiency and discretion, the Assassins Guild garnered an ever-expanding clientele that spanned across the galaxies.

The guild’s creed emphasized a strict code of ethics, forbidding the assassination of innocents and limiting their targets to those deemed a genuine threat to galactic peace or criminal justice. Despite their morally ambiguous work, the Assassins Guild maintained a sense of honor among their ranks, enforced by brutal consequences for any who strayed from their code.

As their legend grew, the Assassins Guild faced opposition from law enforcement, bounty hunters, and rival organizations who sought to bring them down. The guild’s notoriety for their impeccable ability to escape capture only added to their mystique.

The stories of the Assassins Guild became a chilling reminder that in the sprawling expanse of the cosmos, there were always shadows lurking in the corners, ready to carry out the deadliest of missions. The Silent Shadows of the Stars served as a dark undercurrent in the grand tapestry of intergalactic politics and intrigue, a guild whose power and influence left a lasting mark on the annals of the universe.
It appears another party has succeeded before you, leaving the Guild disappointed, resulting in the cancellation of your membership. Feel free to return when you are better equipped and prepared.

I need a pilot who knows how to fly below the radar, make a few deliveries, shake a few hands, and not ask too many questions. This isn't some milk run, these stops are quiet for a reason. Think of it like reconnecting the old network — piece by piece. You’ll be carrying sensitive cargo, so keep your head down and your transponder fuzzed.

You begin your journey as a newly inducted pilot into the Terran Military. With tensions rising beyond Sol and whispers of unexplained anomalies surfacing across the frontier, it’s time to earn your stripes. High Deacon Ramanckosset seeks assistance to protect Paranid convoys that have been repeatedly attacked by Yaki raiders. Your mission is to defend these convoys and help secure safe passage through hostile sectors. Your support is vital to gain Ramanckosset’s cooperation.
Kill the Yaki ships in {sector.name@Lost_Colonies_Mission3_Contact2.Sector} that have been harrsing the Paranid convoys.
I heard you used to be an Argon scientist, I could use your expertise.
